2018-03-15.headline_main: Britain Drops Plan to Scrap the Penny, for Now

2018-03-15.abstract: This comedy set in a particularly idyllic Atlanta suburb has a gay love story, a blackmailing weasel and surprising emotional resonance.
2018-03-15.snippet: This comedy set in a particularly idyllic Atlanta suburb has a gay love story, a blackmailing weasel and surprising emotional resonance.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: For the most part, “Love, Simon” is an amiable, slick, silver-tongued teen romantic comedy. Set in a particularly idyllic Atlanta suburb, replete with lifestyle wish-fulfillment production design, it’s the kind of movie in which the filmmakers signal their exquisite taste by proxy. (Said filmmakers are the director Greg Berlanti and the screenwriters Elizabeth Berger and Isaac Aptaker, adapting a novel by Becky Albertalli.) For instance, when Simon, the lead character, needs to choose an email address from which to send a series of love letters to an anonymous subject, he adapts a lyric from the Kinks’ classic album “Something Else by the Kinks.” Which Simon enjoys on vinyl, of course.
2018-03-15.headline_main: Review: In ‘Love, Simon,’ a Glossy Teen Romance, the Hero Has a Secret

2018-03-15.abstract: An Algonquin Canadian chef uses food to reclaim her culture amid recent murders and a history of forced assimilation.
2018-03-15.snippet: An Algonquin Canadian chef uses food to reclaim her culture amid recent murders and a history of forced assimilation.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: The Reader Center is one way we in the newsroom are trying to connect with you, by highlighting your perspectives and experiences and offering insight into how we work.
2018-03-15.headline_main: An Algonquin Chef Fights to Restore Indigenous Cuisine

2018-03-15.abstract: With roughly 850 stations, iHeartRadio still wields considerable power in the industry. But it has been weighed down by a $20 billion debt load for years.
2018-03-15.snippet: With roughly 850 stations, iHeartRadio still wields considerable power in the industry. But it has been weighed down by a $20 billion debt load for years.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: Ed Sheeran, Eminem, Maroon 5 and Cardi B all performed on Sunday night as part of the iHeartRadio Music Awards, a testament to the company’s dominance over the radio business. Its roughly 850 stations, the most of any American broadcaster, still wield considerable hitmaking power, even in the age of streaming.
2018-03-15.headline_main: IHeartMedia, U.S.’s Largest Radio Broadcaster, Files for Bankruptcy

2018-03-15.abstract: Investors entranced by the Silicon Valley myth were no match for a whiz-kid con artist.
2018-03-15.snippet: Investors entranced by the Silicon Valley myth were no match for a whiz-kid con artist.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: Dozens of biotechnology start-ups across the country are investing in the research and development that Big Pharma has stopped funding. Clementia, for instance, is zeroing in on rare bone diseases. Catabasis Pharmaceuticals is focused on amyotrophic lateral sclerosis and other terrible neurological conditions. Quanterix and others are developing blood-based diagnostic tests to help doctors offer more targeted cancer treatments, for example.
2018-03-15.headline_main: Theranos’s Fraud Tested the Limits of the Disruption Tale

2018-03-15.abstract: The court order is the first known time the special counsel has demanded that records directly related to the president’s businesses be turned over.
2018-03-15.snippet: The court order is the first known time the special counsel has demanded that records directly related to the president’s businesses be turned over.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, has subpoenaed the Trump Organization in recent weeks to turn over documents, including some related to Russia, according to two people briefed on the matter. The order is the first known instance of the special counsel demanding records directly related to President Trump’s businesses, bringing the investigation closer to the president.
2018-03-15.headline_main: Mueller Subpoenas Trump Organization, Demanding Documents About Russia

2018-03-15.abstract: As our correspondent wends his way around Quebec, we want to hear from residents about how they see the future of the province and their place there.

2018-03-15.abstract: Mayor de Blasio’s wife, Chirlane McCray, has raised her profile in New York and beyond, boosting her husband as she mulls her own run for office.
2018-03-15.snippet: Mayor de Blasio’s wife, Chirlane McCray, has raised her profile in New York and beyond, boosting her husband as she mulls her own run for office.

2018-03-15.snippet: An examination of 20,000 patients finds that more than 800 may have genetic conditions.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: Gregor Mendel discovered fundamental rules of genetics by raising pea plants. He realized that hidden factors — we now know them to be genes — were passed down from parents to offspring.

2018-03-15.abstract: The son of immigrants, he challenged discriminatory laws and practices as president of the Mexican American Legal Defense and Educational Fund.
2018-03-15.snippet: The son of immigrants, he challenged discriminatory laws and practices as president of the Mexican American Legal Defense and Educational Fund.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: Joaquin Avila, a lawyer and civil rights advocate who helped level barriers that kept Hispanic-Americans from voting, getting jobs and going to school, died on March 9 at his home in Shoreline, Wash., near Seattle. He was 69.

2018-03-15.abstract: The South by Southwest film festival celebrated its 25th edition with laughs from “Blockers,” scares from “A Quiet Place” and the return of Tracy Morgan.
2018-03-15.snippet: The South by Southwest film festival celebrated its 25th edition with laughs from “Blockers,” scares from “A Quiet Place” and the return of Tracy Morgan.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex. — This year the South by Southwest Film Festival is celebrating its 25th edition, and my, how it has grown. Some of the writers, directors and performers in the mumblecore movies that populated the festival a decade ago have gone on to become Oscar nominees and land Netflix production deals. And now, some Hollywood movies and television shows are making themselves known at the event with immersive affairs. (HBO, for instance, created an entire “Westworld”-themed park.)
2018-03-15.headline_main: SXSW Film: The Movies and Performers That Stood Out

2018-03-15.abstract: The nerve agent attack helped Prime Minister Theresa May unite her warring Conservative Party. But Britain’s opposition is split, reflecting deeper divisions over Labour’s leader, Jeremy Corbyn.
2018-03-15.snippet: The nerve agent attack helped Prime Minister Theresa May unite her warring Conservative Party. But Britain’s opposition is split, reflecting deeper divisions over Labour’s leader, Jeremy Corbyn.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: LONDON — While Prime Minister Theresa May has united her warring Conservative Party by denouncing Russia over the poisoning of a former spy, things have not gone so smoothly for the opposition Labour Party. Among Labour lawmakers, familiar wounds have reopened over the more ambivalent stance of its left-wing leader, Jeremy Corbyn.
2018-03-15.headline_main: U.K. Labour Leader’s Stance on Russian Ex-Spy’s Poisoning Splits Party

2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: Snapchat users noticed an ad that asked whether they would rather “slap Rihanna” or “punch Chris Brown.” On Thursday, the pop star took to Instagram, a direct competitor for Snapchat, to criticize the ad for making light of domestic violence. 2018-03-15.abstract: Resolving its fee dispute with Apple could raise Qualcomm’s share price above what it would have been under a Broadcom takeover, a major shareholder reasons.
2018-03-15.snippet: Resolving its fee dispute with Apple could raise Qualcomm’s share price above what it would have been under a Broadcom takeover, a major shareholder reasons.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: Few investors had more at stake in Broadcom’s $117 billion hostile takeover bid for the chip maker Qualcomm than Jerome L. Dodson, the founder and chief executive of Parnassus Investments in San Francisco, and chief portfolio manager for the Parnassus Endeavor mutual fund.

Once homeless, Mr. Arteaga taught himself to play the violin by watching videos online and later joined Venezuela’s renowned music education program, El Sistema.

2018-03-15.abstract: The first New York retrospective in 35 years of this Regional painter has ups, downs, detours and lots to see and think about.
2018-03-15.snippet: The first New York retrospective in 35 years of this Regional painter has ups, downs, detours and lots to see and think about.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: It probably didn’t help Grant Wood’s artistic development that he became an overnight sensation in October 1930, when his painting “American Gothic,” an ode to the Midwestern farming life, went on view at the Art Institute of Chicago, electrifying both press and public. That’s the takeaway at least from “Grant Wood: American Gothic and Other Fables” at the Whitney Museum of American Art. This scattered retrospective reveals an artist who took few risks or became self-knowing enough to reach maturity, who was easily distracted from and too conservative in his painting. Greatness remained beyond his reach and some of his paintings and drawings are truly awful, steeped in pious nostalgia and American nativism.
2018-03-15.headline_main: Grant Wood at the Whitney Both Thrills and Disappoints

2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: It’s midday at the Royal Opera House in London and some 12 ballet dancers are rehearsing. The auditorium is dark, the stage is lit and the renowned choreographer Christopher Wheeldon is in the circle, watching with a critical eye as the troupe performs a scene from “Corybantic Games,” a new ballet dedicated to the late American composer Leonard Bernstein. He’s directing over a loudspeaker. “Can we lengthen those extensions?” he says. “And orchestra, we need to speed up the tempo a bit.”
2018-03-15.headline_main: A Fashion Designer’s Otherworldly Costumes for the Royal Ballet

2018-03-15.abstract: I wish McKenney’s life had been as joyous and carefree as her effervescent memoirs. But I rejoice that her books are still available at my hometown library.
2018-03-15.snippet: I wish McKenney’s life had been as joyous and carefree as her effervescent memoirs. But I rejoice that her books are still available at my hometown library.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: The Enoch Pratt, as Baltimore’s public library is known, uses Library of Congress classifications, which not even a nerdy librarian’s daughter such as myself could memorize. So I prowled the “Humanities” department for books about the Marx Brothers and Broadway musicals. These volumes lived in proximity to the satirical histories by Will Cuppy and Richard Armour, beloved by my father. Those, in turn, were shelved near the “humorous” memoirs. It was there — in a subset of PS 3525.A25 to be precise — that I discovered one of the great comic writers of the 20th century, Ruth McKenney.
2018-03-15.headline_main: In Praise of Ruth McKenney

2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: Meryl Meisler arrived in New York in 1975, when she was on the cusp of turning 24 and the city was on the brink of bankruptcy. Times Square had yet to be tamed, streets were dirty and all the federal government could do when asked for help was to tell the city — in the memorable formation of The New York Daily News — “Drop dead.”

2018-03-15.headline_main: Streaming Soon: A Fight Over AT&T, Time Warner, and the Future of TV

2018-03-15.abstract: The Pennsylvania special election vote suggests Republican bait and switch doesn’t work like it used to.
2018-03-15.snippet: The Pennsylvania special election vote suggests Republican bait and switch doesn’t work like it used to.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: There’s no mystery about the Republican agenda. For at least the past 40 years, the G.O.P.’s central policy goal has been upward redistribution of income: lower taxes for the wealthy, big cuts in programs that help the poor and the middle class. We’ve seen that agenda at work in the policies of every Republican president from Reagan to Trump, every budget proposal from party stars like Paul Ryan, the speaker of the House.
2018-03-15.headline_main: Voters May Be Wising Up

2018-03-15.abstract: Banksy’s latest work, a 70-foot-long piece at Houston and Bowery, honors the artist Zehra Dogan, who was jailed for painting Turkish ruins.
2018-03-15.snippet: Banksy’s latest work, a 70-foot-long piece at Houston and Bowery, honors the artist Zehra Dogan, who was jailed for painting Turkish ruins.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: The corner of Houston Street and the Bowery has been home to murals by some of the world’s most renowned street artists, from Keith Haring to Os Gêmeos to JR. The latest titan of street art to take over the giant canvas? Banksy.
2018-03-15.headline_main: New Banksy Mural in New York Protests Turkish Artist’s Imprisonment

2018-03-15.abstract: The “digital curfew” is an incomplete solution to mob violence in Sri Lanka and elsewhere
2018-03-15.snippet: The “digital curfew” is an incomplete solution to mob violence in Sri Lanka and elsewhere
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: After a weeklong blackout, the Sri Lankan government lifted its nationwide ban on social media on Thursday. Facebook and several other platforms had been shut down after days of violence targeting Muslims in the Kandy district, a popular destination for tourists and pilgrims. The violence began after a Sinhalese Buddhist truck driver was killed in a road-rage incident. Buddhist chauvinist groups flocked to the area, and their visits were followed by looting, arson, and attacks on mosques and on businesses operated by Muslims.
2018-03-15.headline_main: Banning Social Media Won’t Stop Hate Speech

2018-03-15.abstract: A ruling this week largely upheld the state’s immigration law, often called the “show me your papers” law. But how it will be put into effect remains a question.
2018-03-15.snippet: A ruling this week largely upheld the state’s immigration law, often called the “show me your papers” law. But how it will be put into effect remains a question.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — It is often called Texas’ “show me your papers” law, but few papers are actually being shown in some of the state’s biggest cities.
2018-03-15.headline_main: Texas Banned ‘Sanctuary Cities.’ Some Police Departments Didn’t Get the Memo.

2018-03-15.abstract: The lawsuit states that Mr. Levine denies the accusations of abuse. It paints his firing as a result of a longstanding plan to oust him from the Met.

2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Thousands of exhausted civilians streamed out of the besieged Syrian enclave of eastern Ghouta on Thursday, the largest single-day exodus from the embattled region since the start of a punishing government offensive last month.
2018-03-15.headline_main: ‘We Were Dying in There’: Thousands of Syrians Flee Rebel Enclave

2018-03-15.abstract: In gun-friendly Montana, the walkouts stirred controversy. Two students explained their decisions to walk out, or stay in class.
2018-03-15.snippet: In gun-friendly Montana, the walkouts stirred controversy. Two students explained their decisions to walk out, or stay in class.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: Plans for the student walkouts on Wednesday, when tens of thousands of people left their classrooms to protest gun violence, had stirred controversy for weeks in Montana, where the gun ownership rate outranks that in nearly every other state. In Billings, the state’s most populous city, parents threatened to ground students who left their classrooms. And organizers of a walkout from Billings West High School changed a call for “gun reform” on their Facebook page to one for “school safety.”
2018-03-15.headline_main: The View From Opposite Sides of a Student Walkout in Montana

2018-03-15.snippet: The toy retailer is another failure of financial engineering, one that could portend a potentially more ominous outlook for private equity in the digital era.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: The mood in the courtroom was hopeful when Toys “R” Us filed for bankruptcy last September. The company’s lawyer, in the first hearing, played a clip of the retailer’s famous jingle “I’m a Toys ‘R’ Us Kid” and vowed to restore the company’s place in the hearts of millions of American families.
2018-03-15.headline_main: Toys ‘R’ Us Case Is Test of Private Equity in Age of Amazon

2018-03-15.abstract: A Democratic candidate wins while reinforcing his party’s soul.
2018-03-15.snippet: A Democratic candidate wins while reinforcing his party’s soul.
2018-03-15.lead_paragraph: Every election cycle we say that so and so is fighting for the soul of the Democratic Party, or the soul of the Republican Party. And, of course, most of the time it’s not true. Most of the time the fight is over whether the party in question should go to the left or the right on some policy issue, which is important but not really a matter of a party’s soul.
2018-03-15.headline_main: Worthy Is the Lamb

2018-03-16.abstract: Marilyn Stasio’s mystery column visits the canals of Venice and the cliffs of southern Britain, with American pit stops at a mortuary and a motel.
2018-03-16.snippet: Marilyn Stasio’s mystery column visits the canals of Venice and the cliffs of southern Britain, with American pit stops at a mortuary and a motel.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: The Venetian settings are enchanting and Commissario Guido Brunetti’s investigative methods are drolly amusing. But it’s the living, bleeding humanity of the characters that makes Donna Leon’s police procedurals so engaging. In THE TEMPTATION OF FORGIVENESS (Atlantic Monthly, $26), Brunetti comes to the assistance of Professoressa Crosera, whose 15-year-old son is taking drugs and whose husband suffered a brain injury after being thrown down the stone steps of a bridge. In his sensitive dealings with the victims of crime, Brunetti proves as much a psychologist and social worker as a cop: When the distraught Signora Crosera appears to be on the verge of a breakdown, he escorts her home and urges her to cook dinner for her children, “to show them you’re all right and life is normal.”

This season frontloaded its villains (Morgan McMichaels, Thorgy Thor, Milk), mishandled one hero (Chi Chi DeVayne) and let another (BenDeLaCreme) go on walkabout, and came up short on what’s usually so special about “RuPaul’s Drag Race”: heart and stakes and the sense that lives are being changed. He has also created big participatory spectacles like “The Frozen Scream,” a “haunted” murder mystery that takes the audience backstage, and “Office Party,” a decidedly not-safe-for-work bacchanal that veers from bad managerial speeches to embarrassing dancing and beyond.

2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: We discuss “A Wrinkle in Time” and what it means to criticize black works or art.

2018-03-16.abstract: We discuss “A Wrinkle in Time” and what it means to criticize black works or art.
2018-03-16.snippet: We discuss “A Wrinkle in Time” and what it means to criticize black works or art.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: This week, we discuss “A Wrinkle in Time,” Ava DuVernay’s attempt to take the audience on a magical adventure with Meg Murray as she searches for her father through multiple universes. Our time traveling experience ... wasn’t as magical as we hoped. But this is good news. We explain why the film’s shortcomings do not affect the upward trajectory of Ava DuVernay’s career or of black filmmaking in general, but actually work to highlight the progress of black filmmakers and encourage black artists to take bigger risks. We dive deep into what it means to criticize black works of art and express what gets lost when we decide it’s beyond criticism.
2018-03-16.headline_main: Still Processing: We Don’t Love Everything Made by Black People, and That’s O.K.?

2018-03-16.headline_main: Listen to ‘Still Processing’

2018-03-16.abstract: We discuss the portraits of Barack and Michelle, beauty and presidential power.
2018-03-16.snippet: We discuss the portraits of Barack and Michelle, beauty and presidential power.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: We went to the National Portrait Gallery in Washington to look at the recently installed portraits of Barack and Michelle Obama. The paintings — Barack’s by Kehinde Wiley, Michelle’s by Amy Sherald — prompted both rapture and controversy when they were unveiled in February, and we wanted to see them in person to try to evaluate our own responses. As we traveled through the gallery from George Washington to Obama, we discussed what portraits can tell us about presidential power. And then we lingered at Barack and Michelle’s portraits, admiring their beauty, trying to decipher their meaning and allowing ourselves to be deeply moved. Come linger with us.
2018-03-16.headline_main: Still Processing: We Paint the Town Obama

2018-03-16.abstract: Readers share emotional tributes to Stephen Hawking, and Dennis Overbye, the Times science writer who wrote his obituary, shares more insights about him.
2018-03-16.snippet: Readers share emotional tributes to Stephen Hawking, and Dennis Overbye, the Times science writer who wrote his obituary, shares more insights about him.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: The death on Wednesday of Stephen Hawking, the iconic physicist and author, at age 76 set off tributes from Times readers. Many wrote emotionally about Dr. Hawking on social media and in our obituary’s comments section, sharing personal anecdotes about meeting him and describing why his work and life mattered to them.
2018-03-16.headline_main: ‘He Lives on as All Great Philosophers Do’: Readers Mourn Stephen Hawking

2018-03-16.abstract: We discuss “Call Me By Your Name” and “Shape of Water” and whether we are entering a new phase of romance films.
2018-03-16.snippet: We discuss “Call Me By Your Name” and “Shape of Water” and whether we are entering a new phase of romance films.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: We discuss “Call Me By Your Name” and “Shape of Water” and whether we are entering a new phase of romance films.
2018-03-16.headline_main: Listen to ‘Still Processing’

2018-03-16.abstract: We discuss “Call Me by Your Name” and “The Shape of Water” and whether we are entering a new phase of romance films.
2018-03-16.snippet: We discuss “Call Me by Your Name” and “The Shape of Water” and whether we are entering a new phase of romance films.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: This week, we examine four of the Best Picture Oscar-nominated films — “Call Me by Your Name,” “Get Out,” “The Shape of Water” and “Phantom Thread” — to ask whether we are entering a new phase of romance films. By diverging from conventional norms and stereotypes, these films have created onscreen relationships that are reminiscent of our own relationships. We then look to the history of romantic dramas and comedies to see how this new version of romance-on-screen came to be and what it potentially communicates about the way men and women are relating to one another.
2018-03-16.headline_main: Still Processing: We Want To Know What Love Is

One of the hamlets within the village was called My Lai.

2018-03-16.abstract: We discuss “Three Billboards Outside of Ebbing, Missouri” and a new sense of placelessness in film and TV.

2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: We discuss “Three Billboards Outside of Ebbing, Missouri” and a new sense of placelessness in film and TV.
2018-03-16.headline_main: Listen to ‘Still Processing’

2018-03-16.abstract: We discuss “Three Billboards Outside of Ebbing, Missouri” and a new sense of placelessness in film and TV.
2018-03-16.snippet: We discuss “Three Billboards Outside of Ebbing, Missouri” and a new sense of placelessness in film and TV.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: This week, we take the Oscar-nominated film “Three Billboards Outside of Ebbing, Missouri” as a starting point for a discussion about a new sense of placelessness in film and on TV. Over the last year, we’ve been seeing stories set in ambiguous spaces — the limbo between heaven and hell, distorted models of our world, towns that look like no place we recognize as American. We talk about “The Good Place,” “Westworld,” “Downsizing” and the Sunken Place from “Get Out” to try to figure out how we lost a sense of where we are. Then we look to shows like “Atlanta” and “The Chi” to think about how we might find our way back.
2018-03-16.headline_main: Still Processing: We Don’t Know Where We Are

2018-03-16.abstract: Being a Paralympic athlete used to be a part-time, do-it-yourself pursuit. Not anymore.

2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: The new capsule collection from Loewe’s Jonathan Anderson was born from the same sense of wonder with which the designer once marveled over his grandmother’s hand-knit quilts. For nearly a year, he and his team searched the globe for the best artisans working with fabric, from manjak weavers in southern Senegal to ribbon embroiderers in New Delhi, eventually partnering with over 100 ateliers to create 50 made-to-order tapestries (plus 12 matching tote bags), which will debut at Salone del Mobile in Milan next month.
2018-03-16.headline_main: A Cultural Compendium of What’s New

2018-03-16.abstract: The liquids in your stomach may help the note survive the crash, novelist Brad Meltzer says. That’s just one thing he learned while researching his new novel, “The Escape Artist.”

2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: PICTURE THIS: Scrolling through Pinterest one day, Tomi Adeyemi saw something that would change her life: “a digital illustration of a black girl with bright green hair.” The image, which burrowed into her subconscious, “was so stunning and magical” that it inspired her to begin an epic fantasy trilogy that draws equally from current events and African culture. The first volume, “Children of Blood and Bone,” which enters the Young Adult list at No. 1, “is an epic West African adventure,” Adeyemi explains, “but layered within each page is an allegory for the modern black experience. Every obstacle my characters face, no matter how big or small, is tied to an obstacle black people are fighting today or have fought as recently as 30 years ago.”
2018-03-16.headline_main: Is Your Plane About to Crash? Write a Farewell Note and Eat It

2018-03-16.abstract: A House member from upstate New York, Ms. Slaughter championed women’s rights, food safety and the Affordable Care Act.
2018-03-16.snippet: A House member from upstate New York, Ms. Slaughter championed women’s rights, food safety and the Affordable Care Act.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: Louise M. Slaughter, a liberal Democrat who represented an upstate New York district in Congress for more than three decades, pushing to protect health privacy and abortion rights and playing a key role in the passage of President Barack Obama’s health care overhaul, died on Friday in Washington. She was 88 and in the midst of her 16th term in the House.
2018-03-16.headline_main: Louise Slaughter, 88, Liberal Congresswoman in 16th Term, Is Dead

2018-03-16.abstract: The energy that elites spend being ashamed of their advantages would be better spent sharing the fruits of those advantages.
2018-03-16.snippet: The energy that elites spend being ashamed of their advantages would be better spent sharing the fruits of those advantages.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: A framed eighth-grade diploma, dated June 19, 1913, hangs on the wall opposite my computer. It belonged to my grandmother, Minnie Rothenhoefer, one of eight children in a German immigrant family, who was forced to quit school at age 14 after her alcoholic father abandoned his family. Her first job was picking onions and her greatest regret — she lived to age 99 — was that she never attended high school. “But there’s no excuse for ignorance when you can go right down to the public library,” she often said.
2018-03-16.headline_main: Stop Apologizing for Being Elite

2018-03-16.abstract: It is 80 years since cheering crowds greeted Hitler in Vienna. A work of public art you hear, rather than see, is asking people to think back on that moment.
2018-03-16.snippet: It is 80 years since cheering crowds greeted Hitler in Vienna. A work of public art you hear, rather than see, is asking people to think back on that moment.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: VIENNA — Four haunting musical notes have enveloped central Vienna’s Heldenplatz, or Heroes’ Square. An invisible artwork’s voice-like sounds swirl down from a former Hapsburg palace, and float across from two buildings on the other side of the huge public space.
2018-03-16.headline_main: An Invisible Artwork Reminds Austria of Its Nazi Past

2018-03-16.abstract: The Travel Desk would like to solicit your ideas of what an actual Wakanda trip would look like. We will feature 10 of the most innovative submissions in a future Travel issue.
2018-03-16.snippet: The Travel Desk would like to solicit your ideas of what an actual Wakanda trip would look like. We will feature 10 of the most innovative submissions in a future Travel issue.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: In the film “Black Panther,” the mythical African nation of Wakanda, known to outsiders as a small and mostly agrarian country, is protected by a holographic camouflage, which shields its advanced society from the rest of the world. Among the many great things about the film is its emphasis on Wakanda’s technological gems, along with showcasing the landscape of the modern country. However, to the casual filmgoer, there is a lot that can be left to the imagination.
2018-03-16.headline_main: We’d Like to Know: Where Would You Go in Wakanda?

2018-03-16.abstract: The cascade of ecological benefits that followed the return of wolves to Yellowstone National Park and Idaho suggests opportunities for similar efforts around the planet.
2018-03-16.snippet: The cascade of ecological benefits that followed the return of wolves to Yellowstone National Park and Idaho suggests opportunities for similar efforts around the planet.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: If you’re lucky, you can spot a gray wolf in Yellowstone National Park. But a century ago, you’d have been hard pressed to find any there. Poisonings and unregulated hunting obliterated nearly all of these majestic canines from Canada to Mexico, their original home range.
2018-03-16.headline_main: ‘Rewilding’ Missing Carnivores May Help Restore Some Landscapes

2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: One morning — a few weeks after the so-called “bomb cyclone” in January had thrown record-low temperatures, high winds and thick ocean waves onto Rockaway Beach in Queens — the conditions remained gnarly. It was 35 degrees, snowing, the Atlantic Ocean was colder than normal at 38 degrees, and the winds were whipping.

2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: The last time the Metropolitan Opera put on Mozart’s “Così Fan Tutte,” in the 2013-14 season, it was to celebrate the return to the podium of its music director, James Levine. He had missed the previous two seasons because of health problems, so it felt like a moving triumph for him to come back with this, an opera that was long one of his specialties.
2018-03-16.headline_main: Review: As James Levine Sues, the Met Opera Opens a New ‘Così’

2018-03-16.abstract: A triple bill set to Leonard Bernstein yielded two terrific new pieces, by Wayne McGregor and Christopher Wheeldon.
2018-03-16.snippet: A triple bill set to Leonard Bernstein yielded two terrific new pieces, by Wayne McGregor and Christopher Wheeldon.
2018-03-16.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The last time Wayne McGregor and Christopher Wheeldon had premieres on the same program was in 2006, at the Royal Ballet. The minimalist, sculptural “Chroma,” by Mr. McGregor, was a smash hit, and led to his appointment as the Royal’s resident choreographer, a title he still holds. “DGV,” an exhilarating ensemble work by Mr. Wheeldon, was perhaps less surprising in its impact, but also a resounding success.
2018-03-16.headline_main: Review: An American in London (Bernstein, That Is)

2018-03-17.abstract: In a court filing, the president weighs in for the first time directly on a case in which a porn actress was paid $130,000 to stay silent about an affair she claims she had with him.
2018-03-17.snippet: In a court filing, the president weighs in for the first time directly on a case in which a porn actress was paid $130,000 to stay silent about an affair she claims she had with him.
2018-03-17.lead_paragraph: President Trump, weighing in directly on the Stephanie Clifford case for the first time, claimed in court papers filed by his lawyers on Friday that the porn actress who alleges she had an affair with him violated a confidentiality agreement at least 20 times, exposing her to damages of at least $20 million.

2018-03-17.abstract: Roland Huget double crosses us, and comes full circle.
2018-03-17.snippet: Roland Huget double crosses us, and comes full circle.
2018-03-17.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — Roland Huget is back, with another beautifully constructed, “super symmetrical” puzzle — so called because it’s symmetrical about the horizontal, vertical and diagonal axes. In other words, you can turn this grid on all four sides and see the same configuration. Accomplishing this involved four 15-letter entries — two across and two down — no mean feat for Mr. Huget, but really mean for us solvers.
2018-03-17.headline_main: Epitome of Completeness

2018-03-17.abstract: Lack of candor is a fireable offense at the F.B.I., but Mr. McCabe’s last-minute dismissal from the agency was carried out against a highly politicized backdrop.
2018-03-17.snippet: Lack of candor is a fireable offense at the F.B.I., but Mr. McCabe’s last-minute dismissal from the agency was carried out against a highly politicized backdrop.
2018-03-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Andrew G. McCabe, the former F.B.I. deputy director and a frequent target of President Trump’s scorn, was fired Friday after Attorney General Jeff Sessions rejected an appeal that would have let him retire this weekend.

2018-03-17.abstract: President Xi Jinping’s new vice president, Wang Qishan, is likely to have a powerful say in grappling with the United States over trade disputes.

2018-03-17.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Xi Jinping started his second term as China’s president on Saturday, flanked by a new vice president, Wang Qishan, who even without any other titles to his name is shaping up as a potent deputy to Mr. Xi, with a potentially powerful say in grappling with the Trump administration over trade disputes.

Like most supporters of his country’s withdrawal from the bloc, he wants Britain to strike out on its own, a fully sovereign state unshackled from Europe’s pettifogging rules and the Continent’s overweening state.

2018-03-17.abstract: The two discuss sexual harassment in the workplace, how to change corporate culture in meaningful and sustained ways, and whether Miss America can be relevant in the #MeToo era.
2018-03-17.snippet: The two discuss sexual harassment in the workplace, how to change corporate culture in meaningful and sustained ways, and whether Miss America can be relevant in the #MeToo era.
2018-03-17.lead_paragraph: Sexual harassment “was not considered anything you could do something about — that the law could help you do something about — until a book was written by a then-young woman named Kitty MacKinnon,” the Supreme Court justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg said at the Sundance Film Festival in January. She was there to attend the premiere of the documentary “RBG,” which will be released this spring. And the book, “Sexual Harassment of Working Women,” published in 1979, argued that sexual harassment in the workplace is sex discrimination and prohibited by equal protection laws.
2018-03-17.headline_main: Catharine MacKinnon and Gretchen Carlson Have a Few Things to Say

2018-03-17.abstract: After I rejected a married male supervisor, my dream job disappeared, but Updike, chronicler of adultery, remained a beacon of propriety and hope.
2018-03-17.snippet: After I rejected a married male supervisor, my dream job disappeared, but Updike, chronicler of adultery, remained a beacon of propriety and hope.
2018-03-17.lead_paragraph: Over 20 years ago, in the fall of 1997, I got my first job, at The New Yorker magazine. A small-town girl from coastal Maine, I had graduated from Brown six months earlier and had been recommended by the writer Francine Du Plessix Gray, a visiting professor there. I had taken the bus to New York City, with two pairs of nylons and two wool J. Crew suits packed into a small suitcase — one black, one a pale, beige-y blush — for my interview.
2018-03-17.headline_main: These Days I Miss John Updike, a Remote and Noble Male Mentor

Set in a fantasy world of Los Angeles boudoirs and boutiques, the clip finds the singer on a frenzied shopping spree, outfitted in what she calls “my bitchiest clothes,” some of which make her look like a walking wad of bubble gum.

2018-03-17.abstract: The Kurds may not have an actual state in what they call Rojava, northern Syria, but they have plenty of bureaucracy.
2018-03-17.snippet: The Kurds may not have an actual state in what they call Rojava, northern Syria, but they have plenty of bureaucracy.
2018-03-17.lead_paragraph: AINISSA, Syria — On a recent reporting trip the photographer Mauricio Lima and I, along with our driver and a Syrian fixer, came to this town in the middle of nowhere in northern Syria because it is the location of the media office and headquarters of the Syrian Democratic Forces, the coalition of militias dominated by the Kurds and aligned with the American-led international coalition. We were required to report there for yet another piece of paper, having already accumulated a hefty sheaf after some eight hours of road travel over two days.
2018-03-17.headline_main: On the Road in Syria, Where Covering the War Is a Paper Chase

2018-03-17.abstract: How can a reader persuade boisterous neighbors to clean up after themselves?
2018-03-17.snippet: How can a reader persuade boisterous neighbors to clean up after themselves?
2018-03-17.lead_paragraph: Q. My condo in Murray Hill overlooks the patio of an apartment in a rental building across the street. The residents of that apartment throw fraternity-style parties that include beer pong. I don’t really mind the parties, but I do mind the hundreds of beer cans and plastic cups strewn all over their balcony, which create quite a mess and are an eyesore. They leave the mess there for weeks at a time. Does this run afoul of any New York City laws since the mess is on their balcony?
2018-03-17.headline_main: When the Party’s Over, but the Beer Cans Remain

2018-03-17.abstract: Douglas Haynes stepped down as president of the $11 billion investment firm, a month after being named as a defendant in a gender discrimination lawsuit.
2018-03-17.snippet: Douglas Haynes stepped down as president of the $11 billion investment firm, a month after being named as a defendant in a gender discrimination lawsuit.

I’m a bookish, nervous woman staring down midlife, someone who likes to be quiet and who tries hard not to go out in the sun. I hate driving fast, I loathe aggressive drivers, and I have experienced a number of serious anxiety attacks when trying to navigate crowded interstates at high speeds.

2018-03-17.abstract: The pope visited the sites where St. Pio, better known as Padre Pio, lived and died, and paid homage to his enduring legacy.

2018-03-17.lead_paragraph: SAN GIOVANNI ROTONDO, Italy — Pope Francis made his first visit on Sunday to the shrine of Padre Pio, one of Catholicism’s most popular saints, with rock-star standing among the faithful, who believe he bore the stigmata, the wounds of Christ’s crucifixion.

2018-03-17.abstract: China, Russia, North Korea and Iran are relying on smuggling rings to secure equipment that can be used for weapons, satellites and fighter jets.
2018-03-17.snippet: China, Russia, North Korea and Iran are relying on smuggling rings to secure equipment that can be used for weapons, satellites and fighter jets.
2018-03-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Foreign smugglers are trying to ship advanced American technologies — which can be used for weapons and spy equipment — to China, Russia and other adversaries at rates that outpace shadowy and illegal exports during the Cold War, according to United States officials and experts.
2018-03-17.headline_main: Smuggling of U.S. Technology Is Outpacing Cold War Levels, Experts Say

2018-03-17.abstract: You’ve evolved to solve this puzzle by Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon.
2018-03-17.snippet: You’ve evolved to solve this puzzle by Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon.
2018-03-17.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — I found today’s acrostic challenging, both in its cluing and the vocabulary in the actual grid. This is fitting, though, because Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon have dipped into an apropos subject with today’s acrostic: language standards, and who gets to dictate how we say what we say.
2018-03-17.headline_main: Variety: Acrostic

But this assumption is outdated, especially as colleges enroll a greater number of academically talented students from poor families.

(Those are leprechauns that look like Farrah Fawcett, obviously.)

2018-03-18.abstract: Voters came out in smaller numbers than the Kremlin had hoped, but the result showed that President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia enjoys broad approval among the people.

2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Russian voters gave President Vladimir V. Putin resounding approval for a fourth term on Sunday, with nearly complete figures from the Central Election Commission showing him winning more than three-quarters of the vote with a turnout of more than 67 percent.

2018-03-18.abstract: The Interior Department sent out dozens of inspectors this month to search for hazards related to cranes used with oil and gas platforms and drilling rigs. Lifting equipment is the second-leading cause of death among offshore workers.

2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A few hours after Conor Lamb, the Pennsylvania Democrat, claimed victory in a House race with a vow to oppose his party’s leader, Nancy Pelosi, the once-and-perhaps-future speaker was explaining to a group of female congressional candidates why she did not retire after 2016.
2018-03-18.headline_main: Nancy Pelosi Wants to Lead. House Democratic Candidates Aren’t So Sure.

2018-03-18.abstract: Men from Dagestan in southern Russia have long wrestled in bouts between mountain villages. Today, the region embraces the sport as an alternative to Islamist terrorism.
2018-03-18.snippet: Men from Dagestan in southern Russia have long wrestled in bouts between mountain villages. Today, the region embraces the sport as an alternative to Islamist terrorism.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: MAKHACHKALA, Russia — Dagestan, a mostly Muslim region in the south of Russia on the northwest coast of the Caspian Sea, is known for the stark beauty of its mountain landscapes, for its many small ethnic groups, for a violent and long-simmering Islamist insurgency — and for its wrestlers.

2018-03-18.abstract: Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said Sunday that Russia had been researching military-grade nerve agents for use in assassinations. Russia denies it.
2018-03-18.snippet: Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said Sunday that Russia had been researching military-grade nerve agents for use in assassinations. Russia denies it.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain has evidence that Russia has been manufacturing and stockpiling the nerve agent used in an attack on a former Russian double agent on British soil, the British foreign secretary, Boris Johnson, said on Sunday.
2018-03-18.headline_main: Britain Says It Has Proof Russia Stockpiled Lethal Nerve Agent

2018-03-18.abstract: The choice of Yi Gang almost guarantees stability in policy as China tries to slow its rise in debt while avoiding any sharp deceleration in economic growth.
2018-03-18.snippet: The choice of Yi Gang almost guarantees stability in policy as China tries to slow its rise in debt while avoiding any sharp deceleration in economic growth.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: China plans to name a new leader for its central bank on Monday in a move signaling that Beijing will continue an ambitious — and, some say, much needed — financial shake-up to get the country’s debt under control and keep its economy growing.
2018-03-18.headline_main: China to Name New Central Bank Chief as It Seeks Continuity Amid Change

2018-03-18.abstract: While President Trump had largely sought to avoid alienating the special counsel in recent months, he has shifted his tone in the past two days.
2018-03-18.snippet: While President Trump had largely sought to avoid alienating the special counsel in recent months, he has shifted his tone in the past two days.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Sunday abandoned a strategy of showing deference to the special counsel examining Russia’s interference in the 2016 presidential election, lashing out at what he characterized as a partisan investigation and alarming Republicans who feared he might seek to shut it down.
2018-03-18.headline_main: Trump Assails Mueller, Drawing Rebukes From Republicans

2018-03-18.abstract: I laughed when I saw it, exactly as Grant Wood had depicted it. Now “the world’s second most famous White House” was mine — for $250 a month.
2018-03-18.snippet: I laughed when I saw it, exactly as Grant Wood had depicted it. Now “the world’s second most famous White House” was mine — for $250 a month.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: Grant Wood’s “American Gothic” painting (and all of its parodies) may be legendary, but most people don’t realize that the little white farmhouse in the background is real — that it’s located in Eldon, Iowa (pop. 900), that it’s owned by the State Historical Society, and that, until recently, it was a private residence. There are only a handful of people who can say they’ve lived “inside” his masterpiece painting.
2018-03-18.headline_main: Masterpiece Rental: My Life in the ‘American Gothic’ House

2018-03-18.abstract: The city in the Syrian enclave was the target of a two-month military operation against Kurdish militias. Tens of thousands of civilians evacuated as its fall neared.
2018-03-18.snippet: The city in the Syrian enclave was the target of a two-month military operation against Kurdish militias. Tens of thousands of civilians evacuated as its fall neared.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: GAZIANTEP, Turkey — Turkish-backed Syrian rebels seized control on Sunday morning of the city of Afrin, the target of a two-month military operation against Kurdish militias in the enclave in Syria. The takeover dealt a blow to Kurdish aspirations for self-administration there and added to Turkey’s growing footprint in the country.
2018-03-18.headline_main: Syrian Rebels, Backed by Turkey, Seize Control of Afrin

2018-03-18.abstract: In these cold, dark days before spring, make some buttermilk fried chicken, and pair it with waffles, or a perfectly Sundayish chicken potpie.
2018-03-18.snippet: In these cold, dark days before spring, make some buttermilk fried chicken, and pair it with waffles, or a perfectly Sundayish chicken potpie.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: Good morning. It’s always darkest before the dawn, et cetera, but I am sick of winter and really don’t want to cook any more root vegetables this week. I want to toss fiddleheads in foaming butter, roast asparagus over an open fire, mess with new radishes, plop a bunch of crunchy watercress down next to a modest steak, then go look for warblers returning north from their winter breaks down south.
2018-03-18.headline_main: What to Cook This Week

2018-03-18.abstract: If talks stall, the withdrawal from the E.U. should be put back, an influential committee said. Some of the panel’s members disowned the report, however.
2018-03-18.snippet: If talks stall, the withdrawal from the E.U. should be put back, an influential committee said. Some of the panel’s members disowned the report, however.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain should seek to postpone its exit from the European Union if talks drag on during the next few months, an influential committee of lawmakers concluded on Sunday.
2018-03-18.headline_main: U.K. Lawmakers Say Britain Should Consider Delaying Brexit

2018-03-18.abstract: An elite unit of the Afghan intelligence agency is accused of staging a deadly raid on field workers as civilians bear the brunt of rising violence.
2018-03-18.snippet: An elite unit of the Afghan intelligence agency is accused of staging a deadly raid on field workers as civilians bear the brunt of rising violence.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: CHAPARHAR, Afghanistan — There was no military curfew in the villages, but, as a precaution, the farmers still informed the local police outpost that they would be in their fields before dawn, with lanterns and shovels, to channel water to their crops.
2018-03-18.headline_main: ‘Killed, Shovel in Hand’: Afghan Farmers Are Latest Victims of a Chaotic War

2018-03-18.abstract: In “The Gospel of Trees,” Apricot Irving recounts the formative years she spent in Haiti while her father was devoted to reforestation efforts there.
2018-03-18.snippet: In “The Gospel of Trees,” Apricot Irving recounts the formative years she spent in Haiti while her father was devoted to reforestation efforts there.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: “My father has never known how to be gentle with those who do not live up to his expectations,” Apricot Irving writes in her new memoir, “The Gospel of Trees.” Ms. Irving spent part of her childhood in Haiti, where her father, an agronomist, was a missionary. He believed strongly, often stubbornly, in the benefits of reforestation in the country. Against the backdrop of Haiti’s natural beauty, Ms. Irving witnessed political turmoil and lived through her family’s own strife. Below, she discusses how time in Indonesia helped her decide to tell this story, feeling like a “reluctant memoirist” and more.
2018-03-18.headline_main: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: A Missionary’s Daughter in Haiti

2018-03-18.abstract: The State House candidate, Leslie Gibson, made the comment about Emma González, also calling David Hogg a “baldfaced liar.” His remarks prompted others to run.
2018-03-18.snippet: The State House candidate, Leslie Gibson, made the comment about Emma González, also calling David Hogg a “baldfaced liar.” His remarks prompted others to run.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: A Republican candidate for the Maine State House who disparaged two teenage survivors of the school shooting in Parkland, Fla., dropped out of the race after drawing heavy criticism and challengers from both political parties.
2018-03-18.headline_main: ‘Skinhead Lesbian’ Tweet About Parkland Student Ends Maine Republican’s Candidacy

2018-03-18.abstract: New York’s next schools chancellor oversaw a district with 56,000 students, then spent 18 months in Houston, now he has 1.1 million students in his charge.
2018-03-18.snippet: New York’s next schools chancellor oversaw a district with 56,000 students, then spent 18 months in Houston, now he has 1.1 million students in his charge.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: If the New York City school system, with its 1.1 million students, were its own metropolis, it would be the 10th largest in the country, bigger than Austin, Indianapolis or San Francisco. And starting next month, there will be a new mayor in town.
2018-03-18.headline_main: Is Richard Carranza Ready to Run America’s Biggest School System?

2018-03-18.abstract: In a new ad campaign aimed at distinguishing itself from low-cost competitors, the airline is emphasizing the in-flight perks included with a standard ticket.
2018-03-18.snippet: In a new ad campaign aimed at distinguishing itself from low-cost competitors, the airline is emphasizing the in-flight perks included with a standard ticket.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: You open what looks like an in-flight care package to find 50 feet of Sudoku puzzles on a roll, Champagne-flavored gummy candies and a scratch-and-sniff patch that smells like boeuf bourguignon. In a time of low-cost airlines, where your ticket might not include a hot meal or free access to electronic entertainment, the box reminds you of what could be if you shell out a little more on Air France.
2018-03-18.headline_main: Air France Reminds Travelers What Their Flight Could Be Like

2018-03-18.abstract: The president has often declared the Islamist group defeated, so its latest mass abduction threatens to become a major issue in next year’s election.

2018-03-18.abstract: “Black Panther” was No. 1 for the fifth straight week, with “Tomb Raider” second. The Christian rock movie “I Can Only Imagine” was a surprise hit.

2018-03-18.abstract: Ola hopes to become a rare consumer technology firm in India that breaks away from home and grows in a well-to-do market where it can charge more.

2018-03-18.abstract: Humans will have to get used to their machine co-workers. But the robot next to you may not be ready to be your replacement. At least, not yet.
2018-03-18.snippet: Humans will have to get used to their machine co-workers. But the robot next to you may not be ready to be your replacement. At least, not yet.

2018-03-18.snippet: A boxing champ who survived an attempt on her life prepares to seek revenge in this multimedia play at Abrons Arts Center.

2018-03-18.abstract: The Trump administration is highlighting the struggles that Minneapolis and St. Paul face with disparities in school discipline, and putting a thumb on the scale.
2018-03-18.snippet: The Trump administration is highlighting the struggles that Minneapolis and St. Paul face with disparities in school discipline, and putting a thumb on the scale.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — When Erin Rathke, the principal at Justice Page Middle School, is called to extract a student from class, she hears the same plea over and over again, most often, she has to admit, from black children: “The teacher only sees me.”

2018-03-18.abstract: Friday’s concert by Alarm Will Sound at Zankel Hall was presented in an explainer format, but the show’s best moments needed little setup.

2018-03-18.snippet: The country’s vice chancellor and sports minister, a notorious smoker himself, promised to roll back a ban on smoking in bars and restaurants.

2018-03-18.snippet: Amiri Taylor is John Lennon. His twin brother, Rahiem, is Paul McCartney. And their stage is down below the streets of New York City.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: A tide of commuters came and went as a Brooklyn-bound F train stopped at the 14th Street station in Manhattan, and a smattering of others milled around the platform, staring at their phones or nothing at all as they waited. None of them paid any attention as Rahiem Taylor strummed his bass guitar and his twin brother, Amiri, tried to reattach the strap to his acoustic guitar.

2018-03-18.abstract: American and British lawmakers called on Facebook to explain how a political data firm tied to the Trump campaign harvested private data from more than 50 million users.

2018-03-18.abstract: The American president wants what he wants.
2018-03-18.snippet: The American president wants what he wants.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: Officials are negotiating the details of a face-to-face meeting between President Trump and leader Kim Jong-un of North Korea. Mr. Trump turned the heads of even his own advisers earlier this month when he spontaneously agreed to sit down and hash out relations with Mr. Kim. A place and date have yet to be determined.

2018-03-18.abstract: Xavier, Michigan State, Cincinnati, North Carolina and Auburn exit much earlier than many expected. Upsets, upsets everywhere ...
2018-03-18.snippet: Xavier, Michigan State, Cincinnati, North Carolina and Auburn exit much earlier than many expected. Upsets, upsets everywhere ...

2018-03-18.snippet: Veterans accounted for 24.3 percent of the American Paralympic team this year, and they benefit from funding sources not available to civilians.

2018-03-18.snippet: The Council held a hearing on authorizing a commission, while Mayor de Blasio appointed members to his own panel to review the City Charter.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: It may not have reached the ear-biting level, but a wrestling match between Mayor Bill de Blasio and the City Council over the City Charter is heating up. Council members on Friday took a step toward creating a commission that would propose changes to the charter — hours after the mayor rushed appointments to his own, separate, charter commission.
2018-03-18.headline_main: 2 Charter Commissions? Mayor and Council Are Creating Separate Panels

2018-03-18.abstract: Fighting has worsened between Pakistan and India in Kashmir, and the shelling of a home in the Indian-controlled portion left five people dead.

2018-03-18.abstract: The lack of an arena-circuit headliner at this year’s festival, the 32nd, just helped level the playing field for the performers who still flock to Austin, Tex.
2018-03-18.snippet: The lack of an arena-circuit headliner at this year’s festival, the 32nd, just helped level the playing field for the performers who still flock to Austin, Tex.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex. — Even past its peak, the annual South by Southwest Music Festival was a prodigious thing, with some 2,000 acts performing in Austin’s clubs, theaters, hotels and parking lots from March 12 through Sunday. This year’s festival, the 32nd, didn’t have any arena-circuit headliner or overbearing corporate sponsorships, reflecting a dwindling recording business. But that just helped level the playing field for the performers — Austin mainstays, international visitors, punks from multiple generations, singer-songwriters, even some SoundCloud rappers — who still flock to SXSW in hopes of being discovered or getting a boost.
2018-03-18.headline_main: South by Southwest Music Festival: 17 Acts That Stood Out

We talked to more than 60 restaurant servers about their experiences with sexual harassment from customers, and pulled it together for a project that examined the way servers balance the abusive behavior they endure against their need for tips.

2018-03-18.abstract: This city’s building boom has reached the place where my family and friends wove a life.
2018-03-18.snippet: This city’s building boom has reached the place where my family and friends wove a life.
2018-03-18.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — There’s a mechanized tyrannosaur biting a hole in the roof of my mother’s last house. It moves hesitantly, lifting its heavy head and widening its serrated jaws before clamping down, then nosing around a little bit, finding purchase between bites, backing up and moving forward to accommodate its long reach, its powerful orange neck swinging right and left to bump walls that stubbornly refuse to fall. I stand at the edge of the yard and watch my mother’s house reduced to rubble.
2018-03-18.headline_main: Nashville Demolition Blues

2018-03-19.snippet: Though his crime was heinous, Herman Bell’s sentence of 25 years to life entitled him to the possibility of release from prison.
2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: Some felt Herman Bell deserved execution or at least a prison sentence of life without parole, but in mid-1970s New York those weren’t options. No question, Mr. Bell’s crime was a despicable assault on society itself. In 1971, with fellow Black Liberation Army radicals, he ambushed two police officers in Harlem, repeatedly and fatally shooting them as part of a war they had declared on the United States.

2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: Often in the final moves of a deadlocked chess match, when both sides have been reduced to a handful of remaining pieces, it becomes nearly impossible for either player to maneuver into a dominant position. With resources dwindling on both sides, neither can muster enough power to get the drop on the other. So both players continue with a futile two-step, alternating between unsuccessful offensives and hasty retreats.

2018-03-19.abstract: A Texas suburb was intentionally flooded to save the city of Houston. We followed homeowners as they decided whether to cut their losses or rebuild.
2018-03-19.snippet: A Texas suburb was intentionally flooded to save the city of Houston. We followed homeowners as they decided whether to cut their losses or rebuild.
2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: After Hurricane Harvey swamped Houston in August, the residents of a suburban area were shocked to learn that the flooding in their neighborhood wasn’t an accident. The homes sat on land that had been designed to flood, as part of a reservoir system built by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers to protect the downstream population of central Houston — a fact that wasn’t publicized when a developer was allowed to build on the land.
2018-03-19.headline_main: As Harvey Raged, Their Homes Were Swamped on Purpose. Six Months Later, They Face a Terrible Choice.

2018-03-19.abstract: Why did it take nearly four decades for the world to realize that she was right?
2018-03-19.snippet: Why did it take nearly four decades for the world to realize that she was right?
2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: In 1954, presumably with no feminist agenda and decades before the phrase would enter the consciousness, John Cheever wrote “The Five-Forty-Eight,” inadvertently outlining the mechanics of sexual harassment as they have only now come to be better understood. The story would go on to become one of his best known, a wounding abrasion to the surface view of postwar American fortitude. Intended as a chilling admonition against female volatility, read 64 years later, amid the current reckoning, it presents itself least ambiguously as a chilling admonition against male entitlement.
2018-03-19.headline_main: Before #MeToo, There Was Catharine A. MacKinnon and Her Book ‘Sexual Harassment of Working Women’

2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: When moral philosophers and others take up an issue that is at the center of public debate, we tend to frame it as a matter of individual ethics. Is it morally permissible to eat meat? To offer money for sex? To have an abortion? Yet, such questions often fail to focus on the issues that are important and relevant for public policy and, as a result, can derail productive public debate.

2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: HANOVER, N.H. — I am a junior in high school, and I regularly shoot guns, for target practice and hunting. Going to school can be hard because most kids don’t understand how I live. 2018-03-19.abstract: What does it say about the contemporary man that the oft-ignored zone is now in?
2018-03-19.snippet: What does it say about the contemporary man that the oft-ignored zone is now in?
2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: For her spring men’s wear collection, Miuccia Prada cinched jumpsuits at the midriff and tucked jackets into high-rise (and twice-belted) waistbands. Rick Owens sliced his pants even higher — grandpa-high — so that they pinched right under the ribcage, and Dior Homme showed a jacket that emulated the exaggerated, hip-jutting form of the brand’s famous Bar silhouette for women, which Christian Dior introduced in 1947. Nipped waists have long represented femininity incarnate — think of Scarlett O’Hara’s famously petite Civil War-era midriff (17 inches), or the elaborate stays and busks worn by Elizabeth I, despite her claim that she had the stomach of a king. What does it say about the contemporary man that variations on the theme are now in for him?
2018-03-19.headline_main: The Male Waist Comes Back Into View

2018-03-19.snippet: Alison Roman’s new recipe for simplified chilaquiles makes for the best kind of meal: fast, and super flavorful.
2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: Good morning. The news from the beach is the snowy owl is still hanging in the dunes at Breezy Point at the western end of Queens, still knocking down rats and rabbits for dinner, still letting us know that winter’s afoot, that even if spring arrives tomorrow, it’s not quite time to head north to the Arctic tundra, the back of beyond. And I’m glad the owl is down there, visiting big, old New York, eating up a storm. It’s a sign, one of many, that we’re really all part of something much bigger than our gigantic city or mid-sized hamlet, our jobs, our struggle, our narrow interests, our particular beliefs, ourselves. Things move around. Food’s a big part of that.
2018-03-19.headline_main: Breakfast for Dinner

2018-03-19.abstract: Farid’s inexplicable connection with Ramon has awakened Farid to the possibility of some overarching force in the universe.

2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: In 1972, the MIT meteorology professor Edward Lorenz introduced a concept called “the butterfly effect” in his groundbreaking paper, “Predictability: Does the Flap of a Butterfly’s Wings in Brazil Set Off a Tornado in Texas?” The term describes Lorenz’s discovery that a tiny event in one part of the world could have an unpredictably enormous impact on weather thousands of miles away. The butterfly effect has since become a central tenet of chaos theory.
2018-03-19.headline_main: ‘Here and Now’ Season 1, Episode 6: The Butterfly Effect

2018-03-19.abstract: Hours after Mr. Ferro’s move was announced, Fortune published an article in which two women separately accused him of inappropriate conduct.
2018-03-19.snippet: Hours after Mr. Ferro’s move was announced, Fortune published an article in which two women separately accused him of inappropriate conduct.
2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: Michael W. Ferro Jr., a Chicago entrepreneur and the biggest shareholder in the newspaper publisher Tronc, has stepped down as the company’s chairman, Tronc announced on Monday, hours before the publication of a report in which two women accused him of inappropriate sexual advances.
2018-03-19.headline_main: Michael Ferro Steps Down as Tronc’s Chairman; Accused of Unwanted Advances

2018-03-19.abstract: The 40-year-old Lue said he has been having heart problems in his third year leading the Cavaliers. It is not clear when he will return.

2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: With just 13 games to go in the regular season, Coach Tyronn Lue announced Monday that he was taking an indefinite leave of absence from the Cleveland Cavaliers to try to address health issues that he has battled for months.
2018-03-19.headline_main: Cavaliers Coach Tyronn Lue Cites Health Issues as He Steps Away From Team

2018-03-19.abstract: The change of a single word in the new tax law means baseball, basketball and other sports franchises could now face capital gains taxes every time they exchange players.
2018-03-19.snippet: The change of a single word in the new tax law means baseball, basketball and other sports franchises could now face capital gains taxes every time they exchange players.
2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As President Trump congratulated the World Series champion Houston Astros at a White House ceremony last week, he also heaped praise on himself and congressional Republicans for passing a sweeping tax cut last year. He hailed Representative Kevin Brady of Texas, the House’s chief tax writer and an Astros superfan, as “the king of those tax cuts.”
2018-03-19.headline_main: A Curveball From the New Tax Law: It Makes Baseball Trades Harder

2018-03-19.abstract: The charges came after a weekend in which three people were killed in two attacks, and as Israelis braced for more violence in the Palestinian territories.
2018-03-19.snippet: The charges came after a weekend in which three people were killed in two attacks, and as Israelis braced for more violence in the Palestinian territories.
2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — A Frenchman working at his country’s consulate in Jerusalem was charged on Monday with smuggling guns into the West Bank from Gaza, as Israelis braced for more violence in the Palestinian territories after two deadly attacks and the destruction of two border tunnels over the weekend.
2018-03-19.headline_main: French Consulate Worker Is Accused of Smuggling Guns From Gaza

2018-03-19.abstract: The Supreme Court turned away requests that it reconsider the constitutionality of the death penalty and how Arizona applies it.
2018-03-19.snippet: The Supreme Court turned away requests that it reconsider the constitutionality of the death penalty and how Arizona applies it.

2018-03-19.headline_main: Supreme Court Won’t Hear Challenges to Arizona’s Death Penalty Law

2018-03-19.abstract: A chocolate-covered and cocoa-dusted confection helps tell the tale of a man trying to revive the coffee trade in Yemen.
2018-03-19.snippet: A chocolate-covered and cocoa-dusted confection helps tell the tale of a man trying to revive the coffee trade in Yemen.
2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: I was deep into a new book, “The Monk of Mokha” by Dave Eggers, about a young Yemeni-American named Mokhtar Alkhanshali, who has been reviving the coffee trade in Yemen, its country of origin. Then, from Dandelion Chocolate, a company in San Francisco, a box of chocolate-covered, cocoa-dusted coffee beans labeled Mokha was dropped on my desk. An intriguing coincidence for me but worth the indulgence for any coffee and chocolate lover. Even if you do not read the book, you can appreciate the confection because the box includes a brief explanation of Mr. Alkhanshali’s story: Mokha Mocha Beans, $28 for six ounces, Dandelion Chocolate, dandelionchocolate.com.
2018-03-19.headline_main: Chocolate Coffee Beans With a Story

2018-03-19.snippet: A woman in Tempe, Ariz., died after being hit by a self-driving car operated by Uber, in what is believed to be the first fatality of a pedestrian from an autonomous vehicle on public roads.
2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Arizona officials saw opportunity when Uber and other companies began testing driverless cars a few years ago. Promising to keep oversight light, they invited the companies to test their robotic vehicles on the state’s roads.
2018-03-19.headline_main: Self-Driving Uber Car Kills Pedestrian in Arizona, Where Robots Roam

2018-03-19.snippet: Protests led an Islamic university to reverse its ban on niqabs, a move that advocates of moderate Islam see as a troubling sign.
2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: JAKARTA, Indonesia — When the head of a prominent Islamic university in Indonesia banned the face-concealing niqab headdress on campus this month, calling it out of step with the country’s true culture, it seemed a significant pushback against the conservative drift of Islam.
2018-03-19.headline_main: Ban on Face Veils at Indonesian University Lasted Just a Week

2018-03-19.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, N.H. — President Trump hired the longtime Washington lawyer Joseph E. diGenova on Monday, adding an aggressive voice to his legal team who has pushed the theory on television that the F.B.I. and Justice Department framed Mr. Trump.
2018-03-19.headline_main: Trump Hires Lawyer Who Has Pushed Theory That Justice Dept. Framed the President

2018-03-19.abstract: His plan calls for reducing the supply of illicit drugs with better interdiction and tougher penalties, reducing opioid prescriptions and overall demand, and expanding access to treatment.

2018-03-19.headline_main: Trump Offers Tough Talk but Few Details in Unveiling Plan to Combat Opioids
