2018-03-26.abstract: A proposed policy would bar the E.P.A. from considering research that doesn't release its raw data for review, blocking some significant work.
2018-03-26.snippet: A proposed policy would bar the E.P.A. from considering research that doesn't release its raw data for review, blocking some significant work.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: The Environmental Protection Agency is considering a major change to the way it assesses scientific work, a move that would severely restrict the research available to it when writing environmental regulations.
2018-03-26.headline_main: The E.P.A. Says It Wants Research Transparency. Scientists See an Attack on Science.

2018-03-26.abstract: She was a child whose exclusion from a whites-only school led to the 1954 Supreme Court case Brown v. Board of Education.
2018-03-26.snippet: She was a child whose exclusion from a whites-only school led to the 1954 Supreme Court case Brown v. Board of Education.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: Linda Brown, whose father objected when she was not allowed to attend an all-white school in her neighborhood and who thus came to symbolize one of the most transformative court proceedings in American history, the school desegregation case Brown v. Board of Education, died on Sunday in Topeka, Kan. She was 75.
2018-03-26.headline_main: Linda Brown, Symbol of Landmark Desegregation Case, Dies at 75

2018-03-26.abstract: Men using hookup apps are at high risk, so AIDS experts applaud a new effort to help subscribers get tested as often as four times a year.
2018-03-26.snippet: Men using hookup apps are at high risk, so AIDS experts applaud a new effort to help subscribers get tested as often as four times a year.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: In an effort to shrink the global AIDS epidemic, the world’s largest gay dating app is changing its software this week to urge millions of users to get frequent H.I.V. tests.
2018-03-26.headline_main: Grindr App to Offer H.I.V. Test Reminders

2018-03-26.abstract: In Ms. Nixon’s first trip to Albany as a candidate for governor, she attacked the incumbent, Andrew Cuomo, and the city’s “old boys’ club” atmosphere.
2018-03-26.snippet: In Ms. Nixon’s first trip to Albany as a candidate for governor, she attacked the incumbent, Andrew Cuomo, and the city’s “old boys’ club” atmosphere.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: ALBANY — Exactly a week after declaring her candidacy  to unseat Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, Cynthia Nixon took her nascent campaign to the state capital on Monday, delivering a bushel of bon mots and attacks on “the old boys’ club” that she says runs Albany.
2018-03-26.headline_main: ‘Mad as Hell,’ Cynthia Nixon Comes Out Swinging in Albany

2018-03-26.abstract: The state is poised to enact several measures, calling it a response to the movement that has grown after the deadly high school shooting in Florida.
2018-03-26.snippet: The state is poised to enact several measures, calling it a response to the movement that has grown after the deadly high school shooting in Florida.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: New Jersey already has gun laws that are widely considered to be among the toughest in the country. One prominent national group that promotes stricter legislation has graded New Jersey as A-minus on its scorecard of gun laws, ranking it second among states, while the National Rifle Association has lamented that “Trenton’s appetite for gun control is insatiable.”
2018-03-26.headline_main: New Jersey’s Gun Laws, Already Tough, Could Soon Get Tougher

2018-03-26.abstract: The modern G.O.P. is no country for honest men.
2018-03-26.snippet: The modern G.O.P. is no country for honest men.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: In 2010 an explosion at a coal mine operated by Massey Energy killed 29 men. In 2015 Don Blankenship, the company’s former C.E.O., was sent to prison for conspiring to violate mine safety standards. In 2018, Blankenship appears to have a real chance at becoming the Republican candidate for senator from West Virginia.
2018-03-26.headline_main: Putting the Ex-Con in Conservatism

2018-03-26.abstract: Gov. Andrew Cuomo’s congestion pricing plan seems to be stalled, not unlike so many New York City subway cars.
2018-03-26.snippet: Gov. Andrew Cuomo’s congestion pricing plan seems to be stalled, not unlike so many New York City subway cars.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: New York City’s subway struggles are not only ever-present — they appear to be getting worse, according to data that show the system’s on-time performance sinking to a new low in January. Under normal circumstances, this might prompt public servants, seeing the exasperation of their constituents, to act or at least propose changes. Not in New York State government, though. Here, the lawmakers who control the subways through the Metropolitan Transportation Authority continue to twiddle their thumbs.
2018-03-26.headline_main: New York City Subways Are Still Looking for a Savior

2018-03-26.abstract: The bipartisan group, including at least four former American ambassadors to Israel, said that “ditching it would serve no national security purpose.”
2018-03-26.snippet: The bipartisan group, including at least four former American ambassadors to Israel, said that “ditching it would serve no national security purpose.”
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: The Iran nuclear accord, assailed by President Trump and his revamped retinue of advisers, received a strong endorsement Monday from a bipartisan group of more than 100 national security veterans, who said the United States gains nothing by scrapping it.
2018-03-26.headline_main: U.S. Experts Say Why Trump Should Support Iran Deal

2018-03-26.abstract: The president has remained in touch with Mr. Porter, the former White House staff secretary, since his resignation, according to people familiar with the conversations.
2018-03-26.snippet: The president has remained in touch with Mr. Porter, the former White House staff secretary, since his resignation, according to people familiar with the conversations.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has stayed in touch with Rob Porter, the former White House staff secretary who stepped down after allegations that he had abused his two former wives came to light, according to three people familiar with the conversations, and has told some advisers he hopes Mr. Porter returns to work in the West Wing.
2018-03-26.headline_main: Trump Talks of Bringing Back Rob Porter, Aide Accused of Spousal Abuse

2018-03-26.abstract: The defensive end for the Philadelphia Eagles is accused of injuring an elderly woman while trying to get on the field after Super Bowl LI in 2017.
2018-03-26.snippet: The defensive end for the Philadelphia Eagles is accused of injuring an elderly woman while trying to get on the field after Super Bowl LI in 2017.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: Michael Bennett, the Pro Bowl defensive end who recently was traded to the Philadelphia Eagles, surrendered to the authorities in Houston on Monday on a charge that he injured a woman in a wheelchair while trying to get onto the field after Super Bowl LI.
2018-03-26.headline_main: Michael Bennett Appears in Court and His Lawyer Denies Charges

2018-03-26.abstract: Since the end of World War II, the victorious powers have promoted trade, democracy and collective security. Now, that order is under assault.
2018-03-26.snippet: Since the end of World War II, the victorious powers have promoted trade, democracy and collective security. Now, that order is under assault.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: LONDON — History was not supposed to turn out this way.
2018-03-26.headline_main: The Post-World War II Order Is Under Assault From the Powers That Built It

2018-03-26.abstract: Federal authorities arrested Keith Raniere, the head of Nxivm, and charged him with forcing women to engage in sex, according to a complaint.
2018-03-26.snippet: Federal authorities arrested Keith Raniere, the head of Nxivm, and charged him with forcing women to engage in sex, according to a complaint.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: Federal authorities charged the head of an Albany-area group with forcing women to engage in sex, according to a complaint unsealed Monday.
2018-03-26.headline_main: Charges Filed Against Leader of Secretive Group Where Women Were Branded

2018-03-26.abstract: Progressive groups want a New York Fed chief who is independent of the financial sector, a voice for labor and a reflection of diversity.
2018-03-26.snippet: Progressive groups want a New York Fed chief who is independent of the financial sector, a voice for labor and a reflection of diversity.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: When William C. Dudley, the president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, announced that he planned to step down, progressives and pro-labor groups saw a rare opportunity to influence an important economic policy appointment over which President Trump has no say.
2018-03-26.headline_main: New York Fed Weighs a Wall Street Overseer, and Left Spies an Opening

2018-03-26.abstract: His widely imitated program, El Sistema, taught classical music to some of Venezuela’s poorest children and gave the conductor Gustavo Dudamel his start.
2018-03-26.snippet: His widely imitated program, El Sistema, taught classical music to some of Venezuela’s poorest children and gave the conductor Gustavo Dudamel his start.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: José Antonio Abreu, who brought free classical music lessons to children in some of Venezuela’s poorest areas, created a widely emulated system of youth orchestras and saw his protégé, the conductor Gustavo Dudamel, win global acclaim, died on Saturday in Caracas. He was 78.
2018-03-26.headline_main: José Antonio Abreu, Venezuelan Musical Visionary, Dies at 78

2018-03-26.abstract: The Catholic Church’s influence has waned, but concerns about outside interference have grown.
2018-03-26.snippet: The Catholic Church’s influence has waned, but concerns about outside interference have grown.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: DUBLIN — As Ireland prepares to vote in May on a referendum on whether to repeal its ban on abortion, anti-abortion campaigners can be seen rallying most weekdays on the streets of Dublin, outside Parliament, and at universities, news media buildings and the offices of human rights groups.
2018-03-26.headline_main: As Irish Abortion Vote Nears, Fears of Foreign Influence Rise

2018-03-26.abstract: After the expulsions of Russian diplomats from the United States and Europe, analysts say relations have reached an alarming state of volatility.
2018-03-26.snippet: After the expulsions of Russian diplomats from the United States and Europe, analysts say relations have reached an alarming state of volatility.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — The expulsion of scores of Russian diplomats from the United States, countries across Europe and beyond has raised, yet again, the question of whether the world is veering back where it was during the Cold War. The alarming answer from some in Russia is: No, but the situation is in some ways even more unpredictable.
2018-03-26.headline_main: It’s No Cold War, but Relations With Russia Turn Volatile

2018-03-26.abstract: A trial might have to wait, but a formal accusation at least takes care of statutes of limitations.
2018-03-26.snippet: A trial might have to wait, but a formal accusation at least takes care of statutes of limitations.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: One of the perplexing questions of constitutional law is what to do about a sitting president who is suspected of having committed a crime. This much is clear: A sitting president should not be required to submit to a criminal trial, an undertaking that would be incompatible with the duties of the nation’s chief executive.
2018-03-26.headline_main: Yes, You Can Indict the President

2018-03-26.abstract: As gun control, immigration and taxes energize voters in both parties, allegations of an affair have intensified discomfort with the president’s behavior.
2018-03-26.snippet: As gun control, immigration and taxes energize voters in both parties, allegations of an affair have intensified discomfort with the president’s behavior.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Representative Ryan Costello of Pennsylvania announced on Sunday that he would join more than 40 other congressional Republicans not seeking re-election in November, he left no doubt about the reason: President Trump’s conduct made it impossible to talk about anything else.
2018-03-26.headline_main: After Stormy Daniels, Republicans Face a Referendum on Trump’s Conduct

2018-03-26.abstract: A science reporter for The Times explains what happened when a tipster’s well-intentioned note about a stroke medicine backfired.
2018-03-26.snippet: A science reporter for The Times explains what happened when a tipster’s well-intentioned note about a stroke medicine backfired.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.
2018-03-26.headline_main: A Medical Tip’s Unexpected Outcome

2018-03-26.abstract: Freeze oligarchs’ assets and bar them from Western banks, then start to protect the American electoral system.
2018-03-26.snippet: Freeze oligarchs’ assets and bar them from Western banks, then start to protect the American electoral system.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: By expelling scores of Russians from the United States and 21 other countries, President Trump and allied leaders have imposed the most significant punishment yet on Russia and its leader, Vladimir Putin. It’s a move that is well overdue for Mr. Trump, whose long refusal to criticize Mr. Putin and hesitancy to act against Russia’s malign behavior have raised suspicions that Moscow knows secrets it could use to blackmail the American president.
2018-03-26.headline_main: Tough Action on Russia, at Last, but More Is Needed

2018-03-26.abstract: Officials say the building is too unstable for investigators to go inside and look for the origin of the fire, which likely started in the cellar.
2018-03-26.snippet: Officials say the building is too unstable for investigators to go inside and look for the origin of the fire, which likely started in the cellar.
2018-03-26.lead_paragraph: As mourners prepare to gather on Tuesday to pay final respects to a New York City firefighter who died battling a fire in Harlem, officials said the cause of the blaze remains a mystery and that the fire-ravaged building must be torn down.
2018-03-26.headline_main: Harlem Building Where Firefighter Died Will Be Demolished

2018-03-27.abstract: The official summary of Morocco’s bid, released Monday, avoided specifics about the total price tag but seemed to take subtle digs at the rival North American bid.
2018-03-27.snippet: The official summary of Morocco’s bid, released Monday, avoided specifics about the total price tag but seemed to take subtle digs at the rival North American bid.
2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: Morocco’s official proposal to host the 2026 World Cup highlights the country’s low murder rate and its “very low gun circulation” — a not-too-subtle dig at a rival bid led by the United States, which is campaigning for the tournament amid a roiling national discussion about gun safety.
2018-03-27.headline_main: Morocco’s World Cup Bid: New Stadiums and ‘Very Low Gun Circulation’

2018-03-27.abstract: Its business model has always been the same, and it’s always been destructive.
2018-03-27.snippet: Its business model has always been the same, and it’s always been destructive.
2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: The recent killing of a pedestrian by a self-driving Uber vehicle is the source of the latest negative headlines about this company. But there’s a much deeper problem. While the leadership has changed — Dara Khosrowshahi replaced Uber’s co-founder Travis Kalanick as chief executive last August after a series of scandals — the company itself has not evolved.
2018-03-27.headline_main: New Leadership Has Not Changed Uber

2018-03-27.abstract: The No. 1 overall pick in the 2017 draft, Fultz had been inactive since October, but he came on as a reserve in Monday night’s game against the Denver Nuggets.
2018-03-27.snippet: The No. 1 overall pick in the 2017 draft, Fultz had been inactive since October, but he came on as a reserve in Monday night’s game against the Denver Nuggets.

And this time around, he looked like the difference-maker nearly everyone once thought he would be.

2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: The series finale of “The Alienist” depicts what came to be known a century later as a “catastrophic success.” A child is saved. A killer is stopped. A corrupt cop gets his comeuppance. A team of investigators sees its unorthodox methods proven sound. At the beginning of the episode, John Moore is so gripped by panic that even the sight of a child’s butchered body comes as a relief, since at least it isn’t his young friend Joseph. By the end, he’s toasting the team at Delmonico’s, glass in hand, smiling and standing between a man he respects and a woman he loves. What a difference a finale makes, right?

2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: These days I spend most of my time writing and working on a documentary series. Though I do love my work, I miss the camaraderie of professional kitchens. So when some chef friends recently invited me to join them for the day, I jumped at the opportunity. Shortly after we turned to peeling and chopping, I noticed two cooks at the other end of the kitchen whispering excitedly to each other. I waited a few minutes, hoping they’d invite the rest of us into their salacious conversation. When they didn’t, I impatiently demanded to know the subject of their gossip. Rolling her eyes, one of them responded, “We’re talking about a recipe, Samin.”
2018-03-27.headline_main: A Lazy Woman’s Canelé

2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: Do you get any flak from men in the skateboarding industry? Or do they think that it’s time for there to be more female professional skaters? I’m sure that it’s out there. I don’t pay a whole lot of attention to it. I know if I scroll through comments on YouTube videos of me — or of other girl skateboarders — there’s always those [expletive] comments, the same rude, homophobic, sexist stuff. But the world that I’ve created for myself within skateboarding — it doesn’t really exist there.
2018-03-27.headline_main: Lacey Baker Wants More Girls to Skate With

2018-03-27.abstract: With the publication of two new books, Gerald Murnane might finally find an American audience.
2018-03-27.snippet: With the publication of two new books, Gerald Murnane might finally find an American audience.
2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: Goroke, Victoria, a former stagecoach stop in southeastern Australia, pop. 200, is not the sort of place you would expect to host a daylong academic symposium. About five hours from Melbourne by car, the town has the feel of an evacuation nearly complete. Empty storefronts line the main street; the local pub closed two years ago. Drive a few minutes outside Goroke, and the only signs of life arrive at dusk, when the kangaroos emerge from the brush to stare down passers-by from the edge of the road. But last December, about 40 scholars, critics, editors and general readers made the journey for a series of lectures on the work of Gerald Murnane. The author, who has lived in Goroke for the last decade, prefers not to travel, and he had suggested the scholars convene at the local golf club, where he plays a weekly game and also regularly tends bar.
2018-03-27.headline_main: Is the Next Nobel Laureate in Literature Tending Bar in a Dusty Australian Town?

2018-03-27.abstract: A selection of books published this week; plus, a peek at what our colleagues around the newsroom are reading.
2018-03-27.snippet: A selection of books published this week; plus, a peek at what our colleagues around the newsroom are reading.
2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: ALIENATION AND FREEDOM By Frantz Fanon. (Bloomsbury, $29.95.) Fanon, the influential postcolonial critic, is best known for “The Wretched of the Earth,” his 1961 book on identity and race. This tome presents his previously unpublished writing — and gives a more personal portrait of the man himself. STORYNOMICS By Robert McKee and Thomas Gerace. (Twelve, $30.) McKee is the king of screenwriting workshops. Here he partners with an entrepreneur to apply his storytelling knowledge to the worlds of advertising and branding. ATOM LAND By Jon Butterworth. (The Experiment, $19.95.) Take a tour through the subatomic world with a leading physicist at the European Organization for Nuclear Research, or CERN, as he explains the electron ports, boson continents and hadron islands you see along the way. THE LIFE AND OPINIONS OF ZACHARIAS LICHTER By Matei Calinescu. (New York Review Books, paper, $14.95.) Living under Romania’s Communist regime, Calinescu wrote this book for his own amusement, a fictional account of a man who spoke his mind. He never assumed it could be published. When it eventually was, it became a cult classic, now in English for the first time. ONE KISS OR TWO By Andy Scott. (Overlook, $25.95.) It’s the classic traveler’s quandary: How do you say hello? Scott, a former diplomat, looks at the variety of greetings throughout the world and in history — using the handshake or cheek kiss as entry point to explore subjects like evolution and neuroscience.
2018-03-27.headline_main: New & Noteworthy

2018-03-27.abstract: Appetite for “green gold” has grown so strong that neither organized crime nor tariffs are likely to slow its conquest.
2018-03-27.snippet: Appetite for “green gold” has grown so strong that neither organized crime nor tariffs are likely to slow its conquest.
2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: Under the volcanoes in Mexico’s Michoacán state, violent cartels are fighting to dominate a shadowy and lucrative market. One gang, called La Familia Michoacana, announced its presence about a decade ago by tossing five rivals’ heads onto a dance floor in the town of Uruapan. The Knights Templar muscled in next, spouting a chivalric code of honor as it taxed, extorted and kidnapped farmers and usurped their land. Mexican security forces and local landowners have tried to fight back, but warring cartels continue to splinter and proliferate. In March, an armed group known as Los Viagras — apparently named for the way their leader’s heavily moussed hair stands up — wreaked havoc by burning dozens of vehicles and effectively shutting down the state’s main highway. One conflagration took place not far from where an American businessman named Steve Barnard owns a packing plant in Uruapan. “It’s too dangerous to drive on the roads,” Barnard says. The farm owners “have to be very careful not to get kidnapped.”
2018-03-27.headline_main: How the Avocado Became the Fruit of Global Trade

2018-03-27.abstract: Influence and authority come in so many forms that we could argue forever about who really holds them. But there are at least some clear winners.
2018-03-27.snippet: Influence and authority come in so many forms that we could argue forever about who really holds them. But there are at least some clear winners.
2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: Our usual message to children is that they have a lot less authority than they might wish. Parents, teachers, adults: These are the people, we explain, who are in charge. But in March, as tens of thousands of children across the country flooded out of their classrooms to protest gun violence in schools, the moment was hailed by some as a tremendous display of power — perhaps especially in those places where school administrators flexed their own authority and tried to prohibit students from participating. “Supporters say the walkouts and demonstrations represent a realization of power and influence by young people,” The Washington Post reported. “So amazing to see young people take back their power and USE it!” Miley Cyrus tweeted. “By myself, I don’t think I have the power,” one student told MSNBC. “But together with all these people here, I think we can make a change.”
2018-03-27.headline_main: Everyone Wants ‘Power.’ Everyone Thinks Someone Else Has It.

2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: Some nights on Peninsula Papagayo, on the northern Pacific side of Costa Rica, the moon shone so bright, with so little evidence of human life, that I felt like an interloper just for bearing witness, for breathing through its stillness. Then I would remember how much it cost to be able to look at that moon from this particular part of the world and the poetry was quickly shattered.

2018-03-27.abstract: A hideous collective self-portrait rendered in oil and wet wipes.
2018-03-27.snippet: A hideous collective self-portrait rendered in oil and wet wipes.
2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: The promise of a modern sewage system is the freedom to forget that the waste goes somewhere. It’s an indulgence that quickly hardens into abuse — which, in turn, hardens into something else altogether. Over the years, in London, millions of tiny droplets of cooking oil have been funneled down into the city’s underbelly from the drains of fried-chicken shops and curry houses, slipping past grease traps in a swirl of wastewater. At the same time, in homes all across town, wet wipe after wet wipe has been flushed out of sight and into the mix, where their plasticized fibers formed a skeleton around which the fat could accrete. Slowly, the incipient mass began to trap tampons, condoms and often a discarded needle or two in its oily matrix, eventually growing into a monstrous subterranean clot the length of 22 double-decker buses with the weight of a blue whale: the Whitechapel Fatberg.
2018-03-27.headline_main: Letter of Recommendation: Fatbergs

2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: In this time of political division, the broad story line of the omnibus spending bill approved late last week is largely a heartening one. With the Democratic leadership in full resistance mode and the Republicans facing a treacherous political climate in the fall elections, Congress repudiated President Trump’s extreme budget cuts in rare bipartisan fashion. In doing so, it protected a range of domestic programs the president had targeted for huge reductions, if not outright elimination, and sent an infuriated Mr. Trump scuttling off to Mar-a-Lago with yet another problem to worry about: a mediocre Congress making a lazy president look even worse by actually accomplishing something.

2018-03-27.abstract: Pino Luongo’s new SoHo place has a daytime and an evening incarnation; sushi gets a new temple; and other restaurant news.
2018-03-27.snippet: Pino Luongo’s new SoHo place has a daytime and an evening incarnation; sushi gets a new temple; and other restaurant news.
2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: COCO PAZZO KITCHEN AND COCO PAZZO TRATTORIA The restaurateur and chef Pino Luongo has always been a game-changer. His involvement with Il Cantinori in Greenwich Village 35 years ago brought rustic Tuscan style to New York’s Italian restaurant scene. Coco Pazzo, which opened in 1988 and was forced to close 10 years ago, proved that his Tuscan approach could work with white tablecloths on the Upper East Side. Now with his business partner, Alessandro Bandini, he is opening another Coco Pazzo, in SoHo, in a brightly windowed contemporary take on that Tuscan farmhouse. And he is serving some pasta entrees that he calls piatti unici; they include linguine with clam ragù, with clams oreganata alongside; and pappardelle with stracotto braised brisket, the pot roast sharing the plate with pasta dressed in its sauce. Mr. Luongo’s longtime collaborator, the chef Marta Pulini, is a consultant. By day, the restaurant is Coco Pazzo Kitchen, mainly for salads, sandwiches and pasta. In the evening, it becomes Coco Pazzo Trattoria, offering soups, salads, seafood antipasti, his piatti unici, and main courses meant for sharing like whole roast chicken or a 24-ounce grilled rib-eye. In the rear of the restaurant is a small shop selling food to take out: 160 Prince Street (Thompson Street), 917-261-6321, cocopazzonyc.com.
2018-03-27.headline_main: Coco Pazzo Returns With a Tuscan Double-Header

2018-03-27.snippet: Lispector’s second novel, originally published in 1946, has been translated into English for the first time.
2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: Sphinx, sorceress, sacred monster. The revival of the hypnotic Clarice Lispector has been one of the true literary events of the 21st century. A national obsession in her native Brazil — her novels are sold in subway vending machines there — she was neglected in the English-speaking world until a splendid 2009 biography, “Why This World,” by Benjamin Moser, charted the clashing currents in her life of fame, glamour, unspeakable suffering and, above all — despite it all — untrammeled productivity.

For its 47th edition, beginning Wednesday, the festival — programmed by the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Museum of Modern Art — is focusing on emerging directors, many on the younger side. The results are invariably uneven, often exciting and at times revelatory in the way they redefine (or even defy) traditional categories and genres. Here are 11 movies you won’t want to miss.

2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: There was nothing traditional about the union of Michelle Mead-Armor and John Armor. She was 57 and he 65, they had a total of six ex-spouses between them, and had dated each other, and broken up, three and a half decades before. They first met in 1972, when she was a 21-year-old student at Goucher College and Mr. Armor, a lawyer, was representing her husband in a case in Baltimore. She had accused her husband of assault and battery. Mr. Armor, though, won the case. Her husband then left the country.
2018-03-27.headline_main: Real Life Can Be Raw, in Marriage and Death

2018-03-27.abstract: The notion that the Parkland shootings wouldn’t have occurred if students had been kinder is deeply dangerous.
2018-03-27.snippet: The notion that the Parkland shootings wouldn’t have occurred if students had been kinder is deeply dangerous.
2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: PARKLAND, Fla. — My first interaction with Nikolas Cruz happened when I was in seventh grade. I was eating lunch with my friends, most likely discussing One Direction or Ed Sheeran, when I felt a sudden pain in my lower back. The force of the blow knocked the wind out of my 90-pound body; tears stung my eyes. I turned around and saw him, smirking. I had never seen this boy before, but I would never forget his face. His eyes were lit up with a sick, twisted joy as he watched me cry.
2018-03-27.headline_main: I Tried to Befriend Nikolas Cruz. He Still Killed My Friends.

2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: The Hoh Rain Forest is one of the largest temperate rain forests in the United States. Situated within the Olympic National Park in western Washington State, the Hoh is protected from commercial logging and is a haven for old-growth Sitka spruce, western hemlock, coast Douglas fir, big-leaf maples and black cottonwoods. The isolated region is far from main roads and development, making the Hoh one of the quietest places in North America.
2018-03-27.headline_main: Sanctuaries of Silence

2018-03-27.snippet: A recent federal appeals court decision underscores how difficult it has become to win damages for violations of constitutional rights.
2018-03-27.lead_paragraph: For all of the attention that we pay to our constitutional rights, we devote stunningly little attention to the more legalistic — but no less important — topic of how those rights are enforced. And as a largely unnoticed ruling last week by the full United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit demonstrates, the Supreme Court has quietly made it all but impossible for most victims of constitutional violations by the federal government to obtain relief.

But spring wasn’t the only thing on my mind.

2018-03-28.abstract: A stripped-down version of George Bernard Shaw’s 1913 drama, which is just fine without the music that “My Fair Lady” had.
2018-03-28.snippet: A stripped-down version of George Bernard Shaw’s 1913 drama, which is just fine without the music that “My Fair Lady” had.
2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: Here’s the ancient Pygmalion myth: Boy meets rock. Boy carves rock into a girl. Boy pervs on girl. Boy gets girl. And here’s George Bernard Shaw’s “Pygmalion”: Phonetician meets flower seller. Phonetician shapes flower seller into a lady. No one pervs on anyone. The myth is a grotesque comedy, the play a much more sparkling one. Maybe it’s also a wistful kind of tragedy about what can’t be chiseled or changed.
2018-03-28.headline_main: Review: A Playful ‘Pygmalion’ From Bedlam? Bloody Likely

2018-03-28.snippet: At Loyola, our poetry workshop was energized by our team’s win, not overshadowed by it.
2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Last Thursday night, Loyola University Chicago tipped off against Nevada at 6:07 p.m. in the Sweet Sixteen of the N.C.A.A. tournament. The weekly two-and-a-half-hour poetry workshop I teach at Loyola was scheduled to start at 7.
2018-03-28.headline_main: Finding the Poetry in March Madness

2018-03-28.abstract: This new class of feminist TV encourages tween girls to experiment, fail and then try all over again.
2018-03-28.snippet: This new class of feminist TV encourages tween girls to experiment, fail and then try all over again.
2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: As a new generation is introduced to the determined young heroine of “A Wrinkle in Time,” a recent crop of empowering, diverse TV shows for girls is popping up on streaming sites everywhere. Some feature brainy female characters who study science and worship Marie Curie. Others feature girls with magical powers, or who lead soccer teams and fight for gender equality. These are girls who save princes, rather than waiting for the prince to save them — a refreshing rewrite of traditional gender dynamics for young viewers, whatever their gender.
2018-03-28.headline_main: Seven Streaming Shows for Adventurous Girls

2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla. — Danielle Collins was 6 years old when Venus Williams won Wimbledon for the first time, in 2000. Collins was just beginning to play tennis at the time, and for most of the next two decades Venus and her sister Serena Williams would provide inspiration for Collins, who is now one of the fastest-rising young Americans on the women’s tennis tour.
2018-03-28.headline_main: Danielle Collins Faces Venus Williams, Who Inspired Her Rise From Public Courts

2018-03-28.abstract: Chicago’s storied Uptown neighborhood has emerged from a decades-long slump with new restaurants and cultural centers.
2018-03-28.snippet: Chicago’s storied Uptown neighborhood has emerged from a decades-long slump with new restaurants and cultural centers.
2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: For decades, Uptown, one of Chicago’s most storied neighborhoods, struggled to regain its early-to-mid-century luster when jazz and swing musicians dominated the music scene and ornate movie halls catered to robust crowds. Despite being well-served by the El, Chicago’s train system, and having a coveted Lake Michigan shoreline, the neighborhood slumped as crime rose and its aging housing stock fell into disrepair. Lately, though, Uptown’s new cultural centers and restaurants have fueled a creative spirit in this highly-diverse neighborhood. While debates over affordable housing and development remain huge issues in the area, Uptown is ready again for its close-up.
2018-03-28.headline_main: Five Places to Go in Chicago

2018-03-28.abstract: Ask open-ended questions. Withhold the unsolicited advice.

2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: Ask open-ended questions, ones that can’t be answered with “yes” or “no.” “ ‘Tell me more about that?’ is a good one,” says Lois Dabney-Smith, a hairdresser turned psychotherapist who is now 82 and retired. (One of her other favorites: “What happened next?”) Observe body language while listening to someone. Dabney-Smith acquired this skill on people-watching outings with her mother to the bus station in downtown Pittsburgh when she was a child. Sometimes physical mannerisms expose unspoken emotions like shame or anxiety. “Learn to look for what’s not being said,” she says.
2018-03-28.headline_main: How to Be a Confidant

2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: When I was 22 and desperate to escape public relations, I decided to get a job at Rolling Stone. Having no magazine experience was hardly an impediment. It was only a matter of attracting Jann Wenner’s attention. So I worked very hard on my résumé. Then I put it in a pink plastic folder, filled the folder with glitter, attached the folder to some balloons and hired a messenger to deliver it. Because there’s nothing that says “serious investigative journalist” like glitter and balloons.

2018-03-28.snippet: Selected by Terrance Hayes.
2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: This sonnet slides (as if along “goose-down”) over a prosody as rhythmic, natural and warm as a nod. The half-shy sentiment is wrought with tender, technical precision. A wondrous mystery opens as the ABABBCC rhyme scheme of the stanzas shifts in the final couplet. A melancholy volta. It is as if there is no rhyme for “this pain-in-the-heart.” Selected by Terrance Hayes
2018-03-28.headline_main: Poem: The Nod

2018-03-28.abstract: The food is delicious. The access to natural beauty is even better.
2018-03-28.snippet: The food is delicious. The access to natural beauty is even better.
2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: The change, and how quickly it came, took me by surprise. One minute we were in the heart of Tucson, Ariz., among the restaurants, coffee shops and businesses you’d expect in a metro area of more than a million people. Scarcely 15 minutes later it was as if we were hundreds of miles from civilization. Surrounded by the muted bronze and sage colors of the desert, my cousin Melanie Kuhlman (and her three children) and I took in the silence, the desert brush and towering saguaro cactuses that stretched 20 or 30 feet into the air. One of the best things about Tucson, I discovered, is how easy it is to leave Tucson. That’s not a knock against the city — I mean it in the most complimentary way possible.
2018-03-28.headline_main: Tucson Is a City That Encourages You to Explore

2018-03-28.abstract: She was having some difficulty breathing, but then things got much worse fast.
2018-03-28.snippet: She was having some difficulty breathing, but then things got much worse fast.
2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: “Are you O.K.?” the man asked his wife. It was 2 a.m., and he’d awakened to find the bed next to him empty. He found his 45-year-old spouse in the living room of their weekend house up the Hudson River from New York City. She had an oxygen meter on her finger and a worried look on her face. “I can’t breathe,” she told him. She’d had chest pain and felt short of breath in the past, but her oxygen had never been this low — down to 89 or 90 percent. And the right side of her chest felt as if it were on fire.
2018-03-28.headline_main: The Woman Was Fit and Healthy. Why Did Her Lung Mysteriously Collapse?

2018-03-28.abstract: Where, but in the Eternal City, is it possible to map a 2,000-year-old eyewitness account of history onto an intact urban fabric?
2018-03-28.snippet: Where, but in the Eternal City, is it possible to map a 2,000-year-old eyewitness account of history onto an intact urban fabric?
2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: Even without a book or a guide, even after two millenniums of crumbling, the image of the seven-branched candelabrum — the Jewish menorah — is unmistakable on the inner wall of the Arch of Titus in the Roman Forum. Stand at the base of the single-passage arch and look up, and the scene in bas-relief ripples to life with almost cartoon clarity: Straining porters, trudging along what is plainly the route of a Roman triumph, bear aloft the golden menorah and other sacred loot plundered from the Temple in Jerusalem in 70 A.D. The opposite side of the arch depicts the victory lap of the chief plunderer, Emperor Titus — who, as an ambitious young general, crushed the Jews’ revolt, leveled their Temple and brought enough booty and slaves back to Rome to finance an epic construction program that included the Colosseum.
2018-03-28.headline_main: Rome, Through the Eyes of Flavius Josephus

2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: Since the Parkland shootings in Florida, Senator Marco Rubio has done many of the things liberals say they are desperate, desperate for decent Republicans to do. He has changed his position on gun control, expressing support for new restrictions: age limits on gun purchases, new background check rules, possibly magazine restrictions. He has co-sponsored legislation encouraging states to issue restraining orders that temporarily would strip people deemed dangerous of their guns. Some of these measures have conservative support, but in other cases the Florida Republican has effectively bucked the N.R.A.

2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: Fifty years later, the 1968 presidential election and the Vietnam War still shadow American politics. But the war actually had little effect on the vote that November — even though surveys showed that Vietnam was by far the most important issue on voters’ minds, they saw little difference between the Republican nominee, Richard Nixon, and his Democratic opponent, Hubert H. Humphrey, both of whom they scored “slightly conservative” on the University of Michigan’s seven-point “Vietnam scale.”

2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: A native of Rhode Island, the photographer Michael Bailey-Gates first moved to New York after high school in order to meet and make work with the artists he had become friends with online. “The internet was my secret passage to photography as a kid,” he says, explaining that he would share his early images of his world through Flickr. “I was always making a big mess at home, taking pictures in private to put online. Photography has always felt forbidden and dangerous to me, but has brought me everything in my life.”
2018-03-28.headline_main: The Emerging Photographer Inspired by Classical Portraiture

2018-03-28.abstract: The unspoken rule of gay cinema and television: Masculine leads only.
2018-03-28.snippet: The unspoken rule of gay cinema and television: Masculine leads only.
2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: As an undergraduate at Duke University, I was something of a campus unicorn. I was anything but quiet about my sexuality and my gender identity. I’d hold my head high sporting bright red lipstick and a full beard; dance on the bar, unshaven legs exposed by a miniskirt; strut unashamed across cobblestones in four-inch heels. I wasn’t just gay — I was a total queen. And for half of the gay men on campus, I was something of a goddess, an inspiration, a friend.
2018-03-28.headline_main: Does Gay Hollywood Have Room for Queer Kids?

2018-03-28.abstract: The comedian says he doesn’t care whom he offends. But he appears to be obsessed with the topic.
2018-03-28.snippet: The comedian says he doesn’t care whom he offends. But he appears to be obsessed with the topic.
2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: Ricky Gervais, the British comedian, does not care what you say about him on Twitter. He does not care if you are offended. He does not care if you hate the latest joke he told about rape, or the Bible, or Caitlyn Jenner, or Hitler or your child’s fatal peanut allergy. And just to make sure you’re crystal clear on all of the tweets he does not remotely care about, he has built his new Netflix stand-up special, “Ricky Gervais: Humanity,” around them — these negligible tweets, the droning of gnats, several years of which he appears to have accidentally screen-grabbed and saved to his phone. (Ricky Gervais: Butterfingers!)
2018-03-28.headline_main: The World Is Evolving and Ricky Gervais Isn’t

The conversations were, as they often are, dispiriting. She was advised to lose 20 pounds. For the cover of her 2016 EP, “Jalopies & Expensive Guitars,” she straightened her curly hair. The songs on it were, for the most part, ones she’d written for other people, not herself.

2018-03-28.abstract: The movie, based on Ernest Cline’s best-selling novel, is set in a dystopian future where a virtual video-game reality reigns, and pop-culture callbacks are legion.

2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: It isn’t going too far out on a limb to predict that “Ready Player One” will turn out to be one of Steven Spielberg’s more controversial projects. Even before its release, this adaptation of Ernest Cline’s 2011 best seller — what one writer called a  “nerdgasm” of a novel — was subjected to an unusual degree of internet pre-hate. That was only to be expected. Mr. Spielberg has tackled contentious topics before — terrorism, slavery, the Pentagon Papers, sharks — but nothing as likely to stir up a hornet’s nest of defensiveness, disdain and indignant “actually”-ing as the subject of this movie, which is video games.
2018-03-28.headline_main: Review: Spielberg’s ‘Ready Player One’ Plays the Nostalgia Game

2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: As the immortal Miranda Priestly quipped in “The Devil Wears Prada”: “Florals for spring? Groundbreaking.” Miranda would be tickled by this season’s reigning prints, for there’s nary a rose or poppy in sight. Instead, stores are exploding with a bounty of colors, patterns and fancies, each one a salve for our differing sartorial itches. The young at heart will appreciate the tie-dye, while the ladylike among us will flip for the polka dots. The truly adventurous will pile them all on at the same time. Here, a guide to the season’s top prints.

2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: In the fall of 2015, Nina Lorez Collins, a former literary agent, writer and mother of four young adults, including a pair of twins, was experiencing a fairly typical middle-aged malaise. She had a complicated second marriage, and her body was betraying her — textbook perimenopausal stuff, awaking most nights at 3 a.m., heart pounding, soaked in sweat. When she Googled “perimenopause,” it amused her to read that one of the symptoms was “impending sense of doom,” and she noted her discovery in an uncomplicated (until recently) manner: a Facebook post.

Not long ago an academic paper by the economists David Autor, David Dorn and Gordon Hanson garnered an unusual amount of public attention because of its estimate that trade with China from 1999 to 2011 destroyed 2.4 million jobs in the United States.

2018-03-28.abstract: The president announced late last week that he is trying again to keep many transgender people from being able to defend their country.
2018-03-28.snippet: The president announced late last week that he is trying again to keep many transgender people from being able to defend their country.
2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: It often seems that there is no end to President Trump’s cruel determination to transform America into a country that divides and dehumanizes its people. After his denigration of Muslims, refugees and undocumented immigrants, the latest example of this disgraceful proclivity is a presidential policy banning most transgender people from serving in the military — the second attempt to do so in less than a year. It puts thousands of servicemen and servicewomen at risk of losing their careers and means countless others may never get a chance to put on the uniform.
2018-03-28.headline_main: Trump’s Heartless Transgender Military Ban Gets a Second Shot

So the villagers, desperate to improve their children’s lives, used branches and leaves to construct their own dirt-floor schoolhouse.

2018-03-28.lead_paragraph: I have spent plenty of time over the past few years talking with Black Lives Matter activists about their work. The conversations are usually about things like systems and policies, strategies for winning change and the path forward. In these moments, just as when we see them taking to the streets in protest, activists come off as strong and resolute, unflappable and resilient.

The 2018 season started back in January with the country-folk rocker John Paul White, formerly of the Civil Wars, then went on to feature the disparate likes of the Broadway heartthrob Aaron Tveit, Rachel Bloom and Adam Schlesinger of television’s “Crazy Ex-Girlfriend,” the Blind Boys of Alabama, and Rosanne Cash, who wrapped things up on Tuesday — with, perhaps tellingly, a set incorporating songs from her forthcoming musical based on the film “Norma Rae.”

2018-03-29.abstract: Open since 1938, Boyds fights back against e-commerce and the rise of the Supreme hoodie with extra-personal service and fancy new designer labels.

2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — In the 1950s, ’60s and ’70s here, as in many big cities, there were dozens of independent men’s clothing stores selling tailored suits, sport coats, dress shirts and “furnishings” (socks, ties, pocket squares) to dapper professionals. Among these were the Arrow Store, Morvilles, Diamonds, Irving’s and Jacob Reed’s Sons. Today, professionals no longer need be dapper, and only one store from that period remains in business: Boyds. Like the Liberty Bell and the stone Rocky Steps, Boyds is a local landmark, and one equally impervious to the shifting seasons.
2018-03-29.headline_main: The Last Great Clothing Store

2018-03-29.abstract: New bars, Michelin-starred restaurants and indie boutiques are enticing, but so are age-old attractions, like Buda Castle and Turkish-era thermal baths.
2018-03-29.snippet: New bars, Michelin-starred restaurants and indie boutiques are enticing, but so are age-old attractions, like Buda Castle and Turkish-era thermal baths.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: One of the largest cities in Europe, Budapest is a regional powerhouse in terms of art, design and cuisine, home to a dynamic fashion scene and more Michelin-starred restaurants than any other city in the former Eastern Bloc. Of course, the Hungarian capital boasts a rich and lengthy history, starting with early Celtic settlements and the later Roman city of Aquincum, before hitting a high point during the Austro-Hungarian Empire. But fans of contemporary pleasures will also find far more than a weekend’s worth of new attractions here. Most of the action lies in Pest, east of the Danube, with scores of compelling new bars, restaurants and boutiques in neighborhoods like the Inner City, the Jewish Quarter and the Palace District. Across the river, stately Buda Castle and renewed, Turkish-era thermal baths reward travelers in hilly Buda.
2018-03-29.headline_main: 36 Hours in Budapest

But Kate Young, a New York-based stylist who counts actresses Margot Robbie and Michelle Williams among her clients, says that it doesn’t take a lot of effort to look stylish  on the road.

On this warm February evening, Vinny, Ronnie, Pauly D and the Situation were in town buying groceries. On the upper level of their Spanish colonial waterfront home, Snooki was showering. Downstairs, JWoww and Deena were preparing a meal of chicken parmigiana and splitting a bottle of wine.

2018-03-29.abstract: There’s a new generation of reporters who take nothing for granted because of what they know about that war.
2018-03-29.snippet: There’s a new generation of reporters who take nothing for granted because of what they know about that war.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: When I first got to Saigon as a journalist, in 1963, I took it for granted that American policy to counter Communist expansion into the southern part of Vietnam was the right thing to do. That was the conventional wisdom from experience in Europe, where the Soviet Union had established satellite countries on its border. My journalistic perspective in the beginning was “normal.” A good American point of view.
2018-03-29.headline_main: How Vietnam Changed Journalism

It’s just that, like the Wild West preacher who keeps accidentally wandering into Fannie Porter’s house of ill repute, Corbyn has an odd knack for stumbling into the arms of the Hebraically disinclined.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Jeremy Corbyn, Accidental Anti-Semite

2018-03-29.abstract: Should Supreme Court justices go beyond the court record in deciding cases?
2018-03-29.snippet: Should Supreme Court justices go beyond the court record in deciding cases?
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Legal journalists and bloggers have been having a field day with Justice Anthony M. Kennedy’s put-down of Justice Sonia Sotomayor during a Supreme Court argument last week. The argument came in a case challenging California’s effort to regulate “crisis pregnancy centers,” offices that look like abortion clinics but that don’t provide abortions. Some provide pregnancy-related medical services, while others don’t have a doctor on the premises and offer no medical services at all.
2018-03-29.headline_main: How Judges Know What They Know

2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: “The Last Movie Star” centers on Vic Edwards (Burt Reynolds), an alcoholic, washed-up actor who travels to a Nashville film festival to receive an honor without realizing that the event is a small-time, back-of-the-bar affair. (The organizer is played by Clark Duke, from “Hot Tub Time Machine,” while Ellar Coltrane of “Boyhood” plays a colleague who peppers Vic with trivia.)
2018-03-29.headline_main: Review: Burt Reynolds Confronts His Past in ‘The Last Movie Star’

2018-03-29.abstract: Russ Harbaugh’s debut feature delivers something rarely seen in American movies: a warts-and-all examination of extended grief.
2018-03-29.snippet: Russ Harbaugh’s debut feature delivers something rarely seen in American movies: a warts-and-all examination of extended grief.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: For anyone who has recently lost a spouse or parent, “Love After Love” may be almost impossible to watch. Others, though, are unlikely to fare much better, given that this unflinching debut feature from Russ Harbaugh delivers something rarely seen in American movies: a warts-and-all examination of extended grief.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Review: In ‘Love After Love,’ an Unflinching Look at Extended Grief

2018-03-29.abstract: The film, starring Alan Cumming, centers on a 50-something man who lived through the worst years of the AIDS epidemic.
2018-03-29.snippet: The film, starring Alan Cumming, centers on a 50-something man who lived through the worst years of the AIDS epidemic.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: “When I was your age, younger, all my friends were dying,” Sam, a gay man in his 50s, tells his 20-something lover. “I went to funerals twice a week.”
2018-03-29.headline_main: Review: ‘After Louie’ Looks at an Activist Once the Fighting Ends

2018-03-29.abstract: This movie adds a sci-fi kink to the home-invasion thriller.
2018-03-29.snippet: This movie adds a sci-fi kink to the home-invasion thriller.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Adding a sci-fi kink to the home-invasion thriller, Jamie Patterson’s “Caught” is small, strange and surprisingly inventive. The unexpectedness lies in a screenplay (by Dave Allsop and Alex Francis) that cares little for audience expectations, and a mood that shifts from tense to terrifying in the space of a single, unearthly sound.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Review: In ‘Caught,’ a Couple Lets the Wrong Ones In

2018-03-29.abstract: A documentary may be the wrong delivery mechanism for the byzantine exposé that cries out for detailed news reporting.
2018-03-29.snippet: A documentary may be the wrong delivery mechanism for the byzantine exposé that cries out for detailed news reporting.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: From “Roger & Me” to “An Inconvenient Truth,” documentaries have shown that they can be great tools for spreading awareness, even on complicated topics that don’t lend themselves to visual storytelling. But in the case of “The China Hustle,” a documentary may simply be the wrong delivery mechanism for a byzantine exposé that cries out for detailed news reporting.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Review: ‘The China Hustle’ Warns of Dicey Investments

2018-03-29.abstract: A fine performance by Ms. Stone is up against a generic screenplay.
2018-03-29.snippet: A fine performance by Ms. Stone is up against a generic screenplay.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: In her latest starring role, Sharon Stone plays Senna, a woman who has found herself spiritually comfortable, but romantically, financially, and professionally at sea. Senna’s career as a fashion buyer is at a standstill, and her dreams of becoming a designer seem out of reach. Marriage, she thinks, doesn’t suit her. But thanks to the meddling of her friend Darla (Liza Lapira), she meets cute with Adam (Tony Goldwyn), a lawyer with a heart of gold. Susan Walter’s “All I Wish” checks in with Senna over the course of several birthdays thereafter, and we watch as this free spirit changes her ways, locking down a bridegroom to go with her business.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Review: Sharon Stone Stars in ‘All I Wish,’ a Lukewarm Romantic Comedy

2018-03-29.abstract: Edie Falco and Jay Duplass connect romantically in this life-after-prison drama that prioritizes patience and pragmatism over passion.
2018-03-29.snippet: Edie Falco and Jay Duplass connect romantically in this life-after-prison drama that prioritizes patience and pragmatism over passion.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: “You’re not free yet, not by a long shot,” an unsmiling parole officer tells Chris (Jay Duplass), near the beginning of Lynn Shelton’s new feature, “Outside In.” Newly released after serving 20 years for an only vaguely specified crime, Chris is pushing 40 and uncertain how to reclaim a life he left while still a teenager. His small section of rural Washington has barely changed; whether he can still fit into it is another question.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Review: On Parole and in Love in ‘Outside In’

2018-03-29.abstract: Led by a charming pairing of Imelda Staunton and Celia Imrie, this British retiree rom-com delivers exactly what it promises.
2018-03-29.snippet: Led by a charming pairing of Imelda Staunton and Celia Imrie, this British retiree rom-com delivers exactly what it promises.

2018-03-29.headline_main: Review: Two-Stepping to Happiness in ‘Finding Your Feet’

2018-03-29.abstract: Frank Cabot’s garden in Quebec is in part an amalgamation of others that inspired him in his travels.
2018-03-29.snippet: Frank Cabot’s garden in Quebec is in part an amalgamation of others that inspired him in his travels.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: With its leggy white tulips, literal primrose paths and stalks of violet delphiniums stretching to the sky, Les Quatre Vents, the Canadian estate of Frank and Anne Perkins Cabot is a tribute to the glory of horticulture in all its forms — at least all the forms the Quebec climate will permit.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Review: ‘The Gardener’ Cultivates the Wealth of Nature

2018-03-29.abstract: The brainchild of the writer Ishmael Reed and the director Bill Gunn, this film is an uncategorizable work of art — and an engrossing one.
2018-03-29.snippet: The brainchild of the writer Ishmael Reed and the director Bill Gunn, this film is an uncategorizable work of art — and an engrossing one.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: A video-shot story conceived as a “meta-soap opera,” “Personal Problems,” a 1980 collaboration between the writer Ishmael Reed, the director Bill Gunn, the photographer Robert Polidori, the composer Carman Moore and a host of talented performers, is now presented as a work of cinema — proving, among other things, that cinema retains the ability to accommodate the noncategorical.

2018-03-29.snippet: A story of obsession plays out in “Wilde Salomé” and “Salomé,” as Mr. Pacino veers into Camp.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: During the opening titles of “Wilde Salomé,” it announces itself as “a story about an obsession.” Early on in the documentary chronicling both a film and a theater production of the Oscar Wilde play, Estelle Parsons, the great actor, asks Al Pacino, the great actor who’s instigating the productions: “Why ‘Salomé’? You’ve done it! You not only did it once, you’ve done it twice. How many productions have you done?”
2018-03-29.headline_main: Review: Al Pacino’s Journey With Wilde’s ‘Salomé’

2018-03-29.snippet: The outfielder and first baseman was only truly great at one thing. That one thing happens to be baseball’s most important skill: getting on base.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Rusty Staub reached base 34 more times than Rogers Hornsby. He also reached base more times than — among many others — Tony Gwynn, Nap Lajoie, Ichiro Suzuki and Honus Wagner. He reached base 1,000 more times than Joe DiMaggio.
2018-03-29.headline_main: 4,050 Reasons to Appreciate Rusty Staub

2018-03-29.abstract: Nicknamed Le Grand Orange while playing for Montreal — he was 6-foot-2 and had curly red hair — Staub made six All-Star teams in his 23-year major league career.
2018-03-29.snippet: Nicknamed Le Grand Orange while playing for Montreal — he was 6-foot-2 and had curly red hair — Staub made six All-Star teams in his 23-year major league career.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Rusty Staub, baseball’s lumbering Le Grand Orange and one of the finest and most durable hitters of his time, playing in the 1960s, ’70s and ’80s mostly for Houston, Montreal, Detroit and the Mets, died on Thursday in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 73.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Rusty Staub, Durable Batter Who Won Pennant With Mets, Dies at 73

2018-03-29.abstract: Collectors are spoiled for choice during the week of the Salon du Dessin fair in Paris, where many pieces can be had for less than €5,000.
2018-03-29.snippet: Collectors are spoiled for choice during the week of the Salon du Dessin fair in Paris, where many pieces can be had for less than €5,000.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: PARIS — There is an ocean of lower-priced art and collectibles that are not often featured in live auctions at Sotheby’s and Christie’s, or in media coverage of a market whose newsworthiness generally depends on dizzying salesroom highs.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Want to Buy Art Without Breaking the Bank? Consider a Drawing

2018-03-29.abstract: The estate of Christine Beshar, one of the first female partners of a Wall Street law firm, is selling the East End Avenue home where she lived for 47 years.
2018-03-29.snippet: The estate of Christine Beshar, one of the first female partners of a Wall Street law firm, is selling the East End Avenue home where she lived for 47 years.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: A grandly proportioned 14-room apartment on the 11th floor of the 120 East End Avenue co-op building, opposite Carl Schurz Park and facing the East River, is being put on the market by the family that has owned it for more than four decades.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Family of Christine Beshar, Trailblazing Lawyer, Selling Co-op

2018-03-29.abstract: Greta Kline has been cutting a path for fiercely independent singer-songwriters for almost a decade. On her band’s new album, “Vessel,” she gets even bolder.
2018-03-29.snippet: Greta Kline has been cutting a path for fiercely independent singer-songwriters for almost a decade. On her band’s new album, “Vessel,” she gets even bolder.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: On a recent Monday afternoon, Greta Kline was thinking about music and memory. On the way from her home in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, to a French bistro in the West Village, she’d been listening to a favorite song she discovered in her teen years: “Alphabet,” a downcast ballad recorded in 2003 by Jeffrey Lewis.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Frankie Cosmos’s Small World Gets Bigger

2018-03-29.abstract: Mr. Scoates will join the museum from the Cranbrook Academy of Art and Art Museum in Bloomfield Hills, Mich.
2018-03-29.snippet: Mr. Scoates will join the museum from the Cranbrook Academy of Art and Art Museum in Bloomfield Hills, Mich.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Christopher Scoates will join the Museum of Arts and Design as its new director on July 1. The museum, at Columbus Circle, champions contemporary craftsmanship and innovation in the field.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Christopher Scoates Is New Director for Museum of Arts and Design

2018-03-29.abstract: Spies and espionage are having a great run. What kind of spy would you make? Spyscape, a new museum in Midtown, will test your skills.
2018-03-29.snippet: Spies and espionage are having a great run. What kind of spy would you make? Spyscape, a new museum in Midtown, will test your skills.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: “Hello Bill Hamilton.” The silver kiosk displayed its welcome when I swiped the black wristband that was my admission ticket.
2018-03-29.headline_main: I Spy at New York’s Museum of Deception

2018-03-29.abstract: A spate of works like “The Wolves” and “The Wholehearted” use sports to explore ideas about femininity, self-image and power.
2018-03-29.snippet: A spate of works like “The Wolves” and “The Wholehearted” use sports to explore ideas about femininity, self-image and power.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: If you’ve been keeping score, you’ve probably noticed: Women have been getting sweaty on New York stages lately. They punch and kick. They jab and run. They push themselves and each other to their physical limits, until someone erupts in triumph or defeat.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Women on Stage Get Their Turn on the Playing Field

2018-03-29.abstract: Rent, reuse, don’t be picky, go big and you could even do it yourself. You might save thousands.
2018-03-29.snippet: Rent, reuse, don’t be picky, go big and you could even do it yourself. You might save thousands.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: When Nathalie Guedes and her husband, Christopher Zardoya, were planning their wedding at 501 Union in Brooklyn, they knew they wanted flowers — and lots of them. “We’re both from Miami, so we’re used to tropical plants and flowers everywhere,” she said. Still, they didn’t want to spend too much money. Centerpieces and bouquets are often thrown away after the night ends, and as architects, they believe strongly in sustainability.
2018-03-29.headline_main: How to Save on Wedding Flowers

2018-03-29.abstract: Justine Ludwig, who was deputy director and chief curator at Dallas Contemporary, will be the next executive director of the New York-based nonprofit.
2018-03-29.snippet: Justine Ludwig, who was deputy director and chief curator at Dallas Contemporary, will be the next executive director of the New York-based nonprofit.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Creative Time, the New York-based nonprofit arts organization that is known for large-scale public art projects, has chosen Justine Ludwig, who has served as deputy director and chief curator at Dallas Contemporary, as its next executive director.
2018-03-29.headline_main: New Creative Time Leader From Dallas Contemporary

2018-03-29.abstract: A sneak peek at Frenchette in TriBeCa, where Riad Nasr and Lee Hanson will give their Gallic training a fresh spin.
2018-03-29.snippet: A sneak peek at Frenchette in TriBeCa, where Riad Nasr and Lee Hanson will give their Gallic training a fresh spin.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: The cute name that Riad Nasr and Lee Hanson chose for the TriBeCa restaurant they’ll open early next week is not meant to suggest a smaller or less serious French restaurant. “Frenchette” is the title of a song David Johansen recorded in 1978, long before the chefs met in the kitchen of Daniel.
2018-03-29.headline_main: A Kitchen Duo for Decades, Now With Their Own Place

2018-03-29.abstract: Erika Verzutti’s sculptures in the show “Ex Gurus”; Robert Bechtle’s charcoal drawings; and Fia Backström’s riffs on a Nobel laureate’s space epic.
2018-03-29.snippet: Erika Verzutti’s sculptures in the show “Ex Gurus”; Robert Bechtle’s charcoal drawings; and Fia Backström’s riffs on a Nobel laureate’s space epic.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Through Saturday. Andrew Kreps Gallery, 537 West 22nd Street, Manhattan; 212-741-8849, andrewkreps.com.
2018-03-29.headline_main: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week

2018-03-29.abstract: Ms. Skripal was caught up in an apparent nerve-agent attack on her father, Sergei V. Skripal, in Britain, and the authorities have blamed Russia.
2018-03-29.snippet: Ms. Skripal was caught up in an apparent nerve-agent attack on her father, Sergei V. Skripal, in Britain, and the authorities have blamed Russia.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Yulia Skripal, who was found poisoned on a park bench in a small English city this month along with her father, the former Russian spy Sergei V. Skripal, is showing improvement and is no longer in critical condition, the hospital that is treating her said on Thursday.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Yulia Skripal, Poisoned Daughter of Ex-Spy, Is Out of Critical Condition

2018-03-29.abstract: Fast fashion giants like H&M and Zara are hiring diversity managers and using screening technologies to catch offensive designs before shoppers do.
2018-03-29.snippet: Fast fashion giants like H&M and Zara are hiring diversity managers and using screening technologies to catch offensive designs before shoppers do.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Every once in a while, tucked into the stream of speedily made garments rushed into stores, designs with shockingly bad taste stand out: a shirt comparing women to dogs at Topman, symbols of the Holocaust on a top at Zara, a slogan that trivializes sexual consent on a piece at Forever 21, or words like “slave” and “slut” used as decorative details on T-shirts at ASOS and Missguided.
2018-03-29.headline_main: To Avoid More Racist Hoodies, Retailers Seek Diversity

2018-03-29.abstract: The Oscar-nominated actress stars alongside Mike Myers and Simon Pegg in a film directed by Vaughn Stein, making his feature debut.
2018-03-29.snippet: The Oscar-nominated actress stars alongside Mike Myers and Simon Pegg in a film directed by Vaughn Stein, making his feature debut.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Fresh off her Oscar-nominated turn as the sharp-edged ice skater in “I, Tonya,” Margot Robbie returns to the screen as a fictional femme fatale in “Terminal,” which has just released its first full trailer. Ms. Robbie plays a waitress in an unnamed metropolis that looks a lot like the neon-lit, dystopian universes of the “Blade Runner” and “Sin City” films.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Margot Robbie Goes Noir in ‘Terminal’ Trailer

2018-03-29.abstract: Researchers developed a mathematical model to test competing theories for what causes the popping sound that will either irritate you or signal relief.
2018-03-29.snippet: Researchers developed a mathematical model to test competing theories for what causes the popping sound that will either irritate you or signal relief.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: In some households, cracking your knuckles is a declaration of war. Whether you’re in the camp that can’t stand the sound or the one that can’t see what the fuss is about, you might be surprised to learn that where exactly the sound is coming from — what precisely in the knuckle produces it — is still a subject of scientific research.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Why Do Cracking Knuckles Make That Noise? You Might Need a Calculator

2018-03-29.headline_main: Greece and Macedonia

2018-03-29.abstract: The dispute deepened after a dubious mural was defended by Jeremy Corbyn, the left-wing leader of a party seen in the past as a strong ally of Israel.
2018-03-29.snippet: The dispute deepened after a dubious mural was defended by Jeremy Corbyn, the left-wing leader of a party seen in the past as a strong ally of Israel.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The mural emblazoned on a wall in east London has long been painted over, but the image remains jarring: a group of caricatured, stereotypically Jewish bankers playing Monopoly on the backs of the poor.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Anti-Semitism Accusations Taint Labour Party, Once Home to U.K.’s Jews

2018-03-29.abstract: The gamelike simulations of driving muscle cars on a track or rugged trucks in a desert are among the ways car companies try to catch your eye.
2018-03-29.snippet: The gamelike simulations of driving muscle cars on a track or rugged trucks in a desert are among the ways car companies try to catch your eye.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Advances in microprocessor and electronic-sensor technology have helped turn today’s car into an immersive multimedia experience spread across high-definition screens. But car companies do not limit the technological flash to the inside of the car — high-tech, gaming-inspired marketing pitches are following right on its bumper.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Virtual Reality Is Carmakers’ Latest Selling Tool, at Shows and in Showrooms

2018-03-29.abstract: Distraught family members of inmates who perished in a blaze during a jail riot in the state of Carabobo told local media that they were not being given any information about their relatives inside.
2018-03-29.snippet: Distraught family members of inmates who perished in a blaze during a jail riot in the state of Carabobo told local media that they were not being given any information about their relatives inside.
