2018-03-29.abstract: Lena Dunham on “The Female Persuasion” and its cultural relevance in our current political climate.
2018-03-29.snippet: Lena Dunham on “The Female Persuasion” and its cultural relevance in our current political climate.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: It will be tempting for most critics to approach “The Female Persuasion” through the lens of the current political climate — perhaps nigh impossible for them not to. Meg Wolitzer’s 12th novel begins with a campus assault that leads to a protest that leads to an intergenerational feminist debate that takes a turn for the toxic. It’s as if a healthy portion of the Twittersphere were aggregated, swallowed and spit back out as the plot of a literary novel.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Meg Wolitzer’s New Novel Takes On the Politics of Women’s Mentorship

2018-03-29.abstract: The company’s stock has declined precipitously since hitting its peak in early February, battered by disclosures about improper use of its data.
2018-03-29.snippet: The company’s stock has declined precipitously since hitting its peak in early February, battered by disclosures about improper use of its data.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Over the last half decade, few stocks have been more beloved by investors and Wall Street analysts than Facebook. No wonder: After a rocky initial public offering in 2012, it has rolled over one obstacle after another, including the shift to mobile computing and the rise of photo sharing. It delivered revenue and user growth that surpassed even the most optimistic projections.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Facebook Falls From Grace, and Investors’ Stock Holdings Tumble Too

2018-03-29.abstract: As UConn storms into its 11th straight Final Four, its coach and its opponents push back on the recurring grumble that the Huskies’ success is bad for women’s basketball.
2018-03-29.snippet: As UConn storms into its 11th straight Final Four, its coach and its opponents push back on the recurring grumble that the Huskies’ success is bad for women’s basketball.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio — Geno Auriemma even hears it from his mother. “It’s O.K. if you lose,” Marciella Auriemma tells her Hall of Fame son. “You don’t have to win all the time. You win too much. That’s why people hate you.”
2018-03-29.headline_main: At UConn, No Losses and No Apologies

2018-03-29.abstract: A new law in Utah is the first in the nation written to protect parents who allow children to walk to school alone or play unsupervised.
2018-03-29.snippet: A new law in Utah is the first in the nation written to protect parents who allow children to walk to school alone or play unsupervised.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: It is not a crime for parents to let their children play unsupervised in a park or walk home from school alone under a law signed by Utah’s governor last week.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Utah Passes ‘Free-Range’ Parenting Law

2018-03-29.abstract: The Marvel series, returning in August, will be written by Dan Slott and drawn by Sara Pichelli.
2018-03-29.snippet: The Marvel series, returning in August, will be written by Dan Slott and drawn by Sara Pichelli.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Welcome back, Fantastic Four! A video on Thursday about some of Marvel Entertainment’s upcoming comics included a silhouetted image of the Fantastic Four, signaling their return to a monthly series beginning in August. The series will be written by Dan Slott and drawn by Sara Pichelli.
2018-03-29.headline_main: The Return of the Fantastic Four

2018-03-29.abstract: Mr. Walk, who has worked with Ariana Grande and Lorde, represents perhaps the most high-profile music industry employee to lose his job amid the #MeToo movement.
2018-03-29.snippet: Mr. Walk, who has worked with Ariana Grande and Lorde, represents perhaps the most high-profile music industry employee to lose his job amid the #MeToo movement.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Two months after the start of a sexual misconduct investigation into the high-ranking music executive Charlie Walk, the president of the Republic Group, the label and Mr. Walk “have mutually agreed to part ways,” the company said Wednesday night in a brief statement.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Charlie Walk, Record Executive Accused of Harassment, Is Out at Republic

2018-03-29.abstract: On Friday night I will celebrate the Seder in Spain, where piety and poetry once flourished.
2018-03-29.snippet: On Friday night I will celebrate the Seder in Spain, where piety and poetry once flourished.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA — This Passover I am in Spain, land of Jewish ghosts. Spain was once a place where Jewish piety and poetry flourished. Now it is full of neglected sites and abandoned synagogues. Fewer than 50,000 Jews remain.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Passover in a Land of Jewish Ghosts

2018-03-29.abstract: A man’s book of imaginative drawings, creations and innovations inspires and delights his son and grandson.
2018-03-29.snippet: A man’s book of imaginative drawings, creations and innovations inspires and delights his son and grandson.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: "My Grandfather's Memory Book” is a four-minute film that touches on themes of artistic expression, creative inspiration and generational connectivity. It tells the story of Byron Levy, who left behind more than 100 sketchbooks and 2,500 paintings — items that became an inspiration to his son and grandson.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Teaching With: ‘My Grandfather’s Memory Book’

2018-03-29.abstract: Eric Holder, the United States attorney general under President Barack Obama, said Facebook should be viewed as a communication company and be regulated.
2018-03-29.snippet: Eric Holder, the United States attorney general under President Barack Obama, said Facebook should be viewed as a communication company and be regulated.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Eric Holder, the United States attorney general under President Barack Obama, said Facebook should be viewed as a communication company and be regulated.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Eric Holder Speaks With The Times

2018-03-29.abstract: In a wide-ranging TimesTalks conversation, Mr. Holder, the former attorney general, also said Facebook should be viewed as a communication company and be regulated.
2018-03-29.snippet: In a wide-ranging TimesTalks conversation, Mr. Holder, the former attorney general, also said Facebook should be viewed as a communication company and be regulated.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Eric H. Holder Jr., the United States attorney general for six years under President Barack Obama, stepped away from public service in 2015 but has since emerged as a bulwark against the Trump administration, taking a leading role in challenging the president’s policies in court and trying to chip away at the Republicans’ grip on state governments. Mr. Holder discussed his efforts to fight Republican gerrymandering, whether Facebook should be regulated and the potential legacy of Mr. Trump’s presidency in a wide-ranging TimesTalks conversation with the reporter Alexander Burns on Wednesday night in New York.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Eric Holder Says He’ll Sue to Block Citizenship Question on Census

2018-03-29.abstract: The government said it would review access to financial markets, and how wealthy Russians have gained residency in Britain.
2018-03-29.snippet: The government said it would review access to financial markets, and how wealthy Russians have gained residency in Britain.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: LONDON — For years, anticorruption campaigners have railed against Britain’s openness to ill-gotten riches from overseas and the foreigners who invest them. After a nerve agent attack on British soil, and the resulting diplomatic showdown between Russia and the West, that may be starting to change.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Britain Signals Harder Look at Wealthy Russians and Russian Wealth

2018-03-29.abstract: Ms. Griffin, who was widely condemned for appearing in a photo that showed her holding President Trump’s severed head, will play Kellyanne Conway on Comedy Central’s “The President Show.”
2018-03-29.snippet: Ms. Griffin, who was widely condemned for appearing in a photo that showed her holding President Trump’s severed head, will play Kellyanne Conway on Comedy Central’s “The President Show.”
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Almost a year after Kathy Griffin appeared in a widely condemned photograph that depicted her holding the severed head of President Trump, this comedian and actress is making a TV comeback of sorts.

2018-03-29.abstract: Our Tech We’re Using columnist, Brian Chen, is eager to hear feedback from readers and requests for future columns about how Times journalists use tech.

2018-03-29.abstract: Sunflower Bean takes T on a tour of their favorite hometown stores.
2018-03-29.snippet: Sunflower Bean takes T on a tour of their favorite hometown stores.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: On a chilly March afternoon in Williamsburg, Julia Cumming, the platinum-haired bassist of the New York rock band Sunflower Bean, is sorting through worn-in T-shirts and denim at the vintage store 10 Ft. Single when her own voice comes on the overhead speakers. A grin spreads across her face — this is certainly not the first time this has happened. “You’re getting old, so act your age,” the real-life Cumming croons along.
2018-03-29.headline_main: How a Rising Rock Band Shops for Vintage

2018-03-29.abstract: Joseph P. Ganim, an ex-convict who was re-elected mayor of Bridgeport, is now running for governor of Connecticut, and that worries fellow Democrats.

2018-03-29.abstract: With at least 68 dead, the inferno in Valencia was one of the worst in the country’s modern history.

2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: VALENCIA, Venezuela — It began as a jailhouse party. It ended in carnage.

2018-03-29.snippet: The stigma of sleeping in the middle of the day might be disappearing: Several offices have installed nap pods and wellness centers are offering sleep treatments.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Once or twice a week, on his lunch break, Eric Dobesh walks half a city block for a nap in a single-occupancy pod. Behind a thick black curtain, Mr. Dobesh dims the twinkling “stars” on the pod’s black ceiling and sleeps until a restaurant pager buzzes to signify the session’s end.

2018-03-29.abstract: Before it won its only N.C.A.A. championship in 1963, it played the “Game of Change,” sending out an integrated team to face an all-white one from Mississippi State.
2018-03-29.snippet: Before it won its only N.C.A.A. championship in 1963, it played the “Game of Change,” sending out an integrated team to face an all-white one from Mississippi State.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Loyola-Chicago, the 11th seed that has improbably made the Final Four, is the sensation of the N.C.A.A. men’s basketball tournament. But it is not the first time the team has made its mark in the event. In 1963, an integrated Loyola team met an all-white team from Mississippi State as civil rights battles raged across the country. It has become known as the Game of Change, for opening the way for more integrated squads. And it almost did not happen.
2018-03-29.headline_main: When Loyola-Chicago Broke a Racial Barrier 55 Years Ago

2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: SYDNEY, Australia — As a teenager in St. James Parish, Barbados, Paul Carmichael spent his free time writing letters to New York City restaurants. He had been dreaming of a cooking career in America ever since a home economics teacher, sensing talent, suggested he consider attending the Culinary Institute of America. At 15, Mr. Carmichael sent away for a Zagat Guide and began writing to the top-rated restaurants, asking for work. (Lespinasse was the only one to reply.)

2018-03-29.abstract: The move was in retaliation for the expulsion of diplomats by Britain, the United States and their allies. The U.S. Consulate in St. Petersburg will be closed.

2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Russia on Thursday escalated a confrontation with Europe and the United States over the poisoning of a former Russian spy in Britain, saying it would expel 60 American diplomats and an unspecified number of envoys from other countries to retaliate for a mass expulsion of Russian diplomats working in the West and beyond that was ordered this week.

2018-03-29.abstract: The director Aaron Katz plays with film noir conventions in this pleasurably drifty, low-wattage mystery.
2018-03-29.snippet: The director Aaron Katz plays with film noir conventions in this pleasurably drifty, low-wattage mystery.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: There are millions of stories in the naked city, and a lot of them have been filmed in Los Angeles. A city partly made by the movies and defined by them, too, Los Angeles rarely comes off like a lived reality onscreen. It’s a hazy dream, a gaudy fantasy, a noirish nightmare, an Instagramble cliché. It’s no wonder moviegoers and other virtual tourists can map it in their heads without visiting it, even if the Los Angeles they probably know is little more than an aerial view of the Hollywood sign, a cutaway to a clogged freeway and a slavering look at a bountiful blonde.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Review: ‘Gemini’ Finds Murder in a Movie-Soaked Los Angeles

2018-03-29.abstract: “Sally Mann: A Thousand Crossings” at the National Gallery of Art is a record of exploration — into her past, America’s history and photography’s.
2018-03-29.snippet: “Sally Mann: A Thousand Crossings” at the National Gallery of Art is a record of exploration — into her past, America’s history and photography’s.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Sally Mann, born in a hospital that had once been Stonewall Jackson’s home, has lived in Virginia most of her life and always proclaimed her Southern-ness in her photographs and in her engaging and boisterous memoir, “Hold Still.” She says that what makes her work Southern is her obsession with place, family, the past, her love of Southern light, and her willingness to experiment with levels of romance beyond what most late-20th-century artists could tolerate. Add to that romanticism the influence of Southern writers and you get a tinge of gothic. A streak of expressionism also comes into the mix, powered by the will to express feelings strongly and the capacity to make those visible.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Sally Mann’s Haunted South

2018-03-29.abstract: The quintet’s self-titled album touches on prog and noise, but allows plenty of space for the musicians’ jazz backgrounds to shine through.
2018-03-29.snippet: The quintet’s self-titled album touches on prog and noise, but allows plenty of space for the musicians’ jazz backgrounds to shine through.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: In January, an audience at the New School was treated to a surprising sonic shift: placid jazz quickly evolving into punishing metal. The instrumental quintet Starebaby began performing “The Memory of My Memory” in ballad mode, easing into a swaying, dreamlike melody. But before long, the tempo started to stutter and swim, and the drummer and bandleader Dan Weiss nudged the group toward a harsh and forbiddingly loud climax.
2018-03-29.headline_main: Dan Weiss’s Starebaby Mines the Loud Ground Where Jazz and Metal Meet

2018-03-29.abstract: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2018-03-29.snippet: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: There are still a few days left in Women’s History Month, and coming out of the Book Review’s recent theme issue we recommend a number of titles this week exploring the place of women in the culture at large. Women in science: “A Lab of One’s Own,” by Patricia Fara. Women in business: “That’s What She Said,” by Joanne Lipman. Women in television: both “Just the Funny Parts,” by the comedy writer Nell Scovell, and “Stealing the Show,” by the TV reporter Joy Press, who has just signed on as a Vanity Fair correspondent. (Yes, her book discusses “Roseanne,” and much else besides.) There’s also a novel and a story collection, a book of essays about being black and female in white male society, and a graphic novelist’s celebration of rebellious women in history. Changing course — you’ll get the bad joke in a second — we also recommend a new translation of the Bhagavad Gita, a deeply reported profile of a Chinese immigrant to New York City and a biography of Tiger Woods. I warned you “changing course” was bad.
2018-03-29.headline_main: 12 New Books We Recommend This Week

2018-03-29.abstract: A reader wonders whether it’s advisable to “leave politics at the door” and say goodbye to a xenophobic relative in hospice.
2018-03-29.snippet: A reader wonders whether it’s advisable to “leave politics at the door” and say goodbye to a xenophobic relative in hospice.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: I am a multiracial woman from a small family that is otherwise white. A close relative is in hospice care. My family made it clear that they expect me, my (immigrant) husband and our young son to visit him before he dies. But this relative has become active in alt-right causes, posting offensive material about minorities, immigrants and women on Facebook. Some family members have asked me to “leave politics at the door” and “turn the other cheek.” Others threatened to ostracize us if we don’t visit. Should I?
2018-03-29.headline_main: Must I Visit My Dying and Dangerously Facebook-Active Uncle?

2018-03-29.abstract: Nothing will change if we keep consuming problematic pop culture without demanding anything better.
2018-03-29.snippet: Nothing will change if we keep consuming problematic pop culture without demanding anything better.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: It can be very difficult to separate the art from the artist. In the case of Roseanne Barr and her critically acclaimed television show based on her life, it is nearly impossible. I wasn’t going to watch the reboot because I find Ms. Barr noxious, transphobic, racist and small-minded. Whatever charm and intelligence she brought to the first nine seasons of her show, a show I very much loved, are absolutely absent in her current persona, particularly as it manifests on Twitter. She is a supporter of Donald Trump, vocalizing her thoughts about making America great, claiming that with her vote, she was trying to shake things up. She tweets conspiracy theories, rails against feminism and shares Islamophobic opinions.
2018-03-29.headline_main: The ‘Roseanne’ Reboot Is Funny. I’m Not Going to Keep Watching.

2018-03-29.snippet: Emily Flitter’s reporting in Lake Oswego, Ore., revealed that a perfect-looking town can give cover to a campaign of intimidation and fear.
2018-03-29.lead_paragraph: Lake Oswego, Ore., is a tiny grid of low, clean buildings wedged into the apex of the Willamette River and the eponymous, oblong lake. It looks like something a model train might trundle through, the crisp white buildings and black rooftops encircled with perfect pine trees. It’s one of the wealthiest and most desirable of Portland’s suburbs, with a population of 38,945 at the 2016 census.
2018-03-29.headline_main: A Wealthy Suburban Community’s Disturbing Open Secrets

2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: The “black barbershop as sacred space” trope isn’t new; it’s made the rounds in Hollywood, the art world, academia and beyond. Unfortunately for Al, this week’s visit to a no-frills strip mall spot is steeped in none of the barbershop’s fabled camaraderie, current events catch-ups or stress release. When he stops in to get “the usual,” what he gets instead is all the worst barbershop experiences rolled into one, then exaggerated to “Curb Your Enthusiasm” proportions and spun through the signature “Atlanta” absurdist filter.

2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: As the sun set and the tide started to rise around City Island, the seaside village off the eastern tip of the Bronx, Saul Chandler took his seat at a bar called the Snug. Mr. Chandler, 70, a small man who smokes cheap cigars and refuses Budweiser not in glass bottles, is one of the island’s waterfront eccentrics. He is a bar-stool fixture at the pub, known for telling bawdy jokes and paying the tabs of strangers before slipping into the night.
2018-03-30.headline_main: Redemption of a Lost Prodigy

2018-03-30.abstract: One girl goes missing and another tails a murderer all the way to Kenya. Meanwhile a British tourist and a teenage apprentice wind up in the morgue.
2018-03-30.snippet: One girl goes missing and another tails a murderer all the way to Kenya. Meanwhile a British tourist and a teenage apprentice wind up in the morgue.
2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: The little guys always have their day in Martha Grimes’s witty mysteries featuring Detective Superintendent Richard Jury. In THE KNOWLEDGE (Atlantic Monthly, $26), honors go to the London cabbies who have an encyclopedic grasp of the city’s highways and byways, called (of course) “the knowledge.” They also have exclusive use of a pub with the same name (“unlocatable: untraceable, unfindable, unmappable”). Robbie Parsons is one of the “knowledge boys,” but he might not live to make the best use of his skills. When we first meet him, his latest fare has just shot two people to death at the door of an exclusive gambling club, then jumped into Robbie’s cab and demanded to be taken to Waterloo Station.
2018-03-30.headline_main: Child Sleuths and Child Victims

2018-03-30.abstract: Jon Meacham parses the historical record for fresh insight into the events surrounding the death of Christ.
2018-03-30.snippet: Jon Meacham parses the historical record for fresh insight into the events surrounding the death of Christ.
2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: To Homer, as to the rest of the ancient world, what became the Christian idea of personal resurrection was preposterous. “You must endure, and not be brokenhearted,” Achilles tells Priam in the 24th book of the “Iliad,” perhaps the West’s most moving evocation of the tragic nature of life. Achilles, who has killed Priam’s son Hector, speaks starkly, and for the ages: “Lamenting for your son will do no good at all. You will be dead yourself before you bring him back to life.” Likewise, in Aeschylus’ “The Eumenides,” Apollo remarks, “Once a man has died, and the dust has soaked up his blood, there is no resurrection.”
2018-03-30.headline_main: Jesus Died Only to Rise Again. Where Did the Concept of the Resurrection Come From?

2018-03-30.abstract: Long ago, George — who’s just published her 20th Inspector Lynley novel — read about the diary Steinbeck kept while writing “East of Eden,” and it inspired her to start her own.
2018-03-30.snippet: Long ago, George — who’s just published her 20th Inspector Lynley novel — read about the diary Steinbeck kept while writing “East of Eden,” and it inspired her to start her own.
2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: FULL ENGLISH Long ago, the mystery writer Elizabeth George — inspired by John Steinbeck’s “Journal of a Novel,” a collection of letters he wrote to his editor while working on “East of Eden” — began to keep a diary, jotting down ideas, research issues, plot problems and the like. “Actually, I used to keep two journals,” she admits, “one about the book I was working on, which I wrote every morning, and one more personal, which I wrote every night, about the struggles I was dealing with in my own life. But the two have merged.” Even today — she’s just published her 20th Inspector Lynley novel, “The Punishment She Deserves,” which debuts on the hardcover fiction list at No. 2 — she still finds journaling useful.
2018-03-30.headline_main: What’s the Connection Between John Steinbeck and Elizabeth George?

2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: At story hour in Tacoma, we sit — strangers in a circle — and sing nursery rhymes to our babies. Since my family and I left Georgia, where my husband, Andrew, was stationed for five years with the Army, I have been eagerly anticipating moments like this: communion with like-minded parents, the kind of NPR-listening liberals I’d spent my 20s around in Brooklyn before the Army uprooted me, transforming me into the proverbial stranger in a strange land. But now that I’m here, desperately trying to follow along — Where is thumbkin, where is thumbkin? — I feel utterly out of place.
2018-03-30.headline_main: Story Hour, Off the Army Base

2018-03-30.abstract: Ms. Carter, who lives in Hunts Point, stays in her neighborhood for church, cycling class and coffee shop hang time.
2018-03-30.snippet: Ms. Carter, who lives in Hunts Point, stays in her neighborhood for church, cycling class and coffee shop hang time.
2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: Majora Carter, an emerging-market real estate developer, is committed to further developing the neighborhood where she lives: Hunts Point, in the South Bronx. There, she is the co-owner of the Boogie Down Grind Café and also helped an entrepreneur start EyeCycleNYC, the first boutique indoor cycling and yoga studio in the South Bronx. She and her partners are also hoping to convert a former railway station on Hunts Point Avenue, designed by Cass Gilbert, into a food hall. “I have launched and exited so many organizations and companies that I’m probably unemployable,” said Ms. Carter, 51. She lives in a brownstone, two blocks from the one she grew up in, with her husband and business partner, James Chase, and their two dogs, Monkey, a German shepherd, and Khalessi, a shepherd/collie mix.
2018-03-30.headline_main: How Majora Carter, South Bronx Booster, Spends Her Sundays

2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — For sheer quantity of opera, few cities can rival Berlin, which has three major companies to serve a population of 3.5 million. The current season is even more eventful than usual: The Staatsoper, which tends to attract the most star singers of the three, has returned to its newly renovated theater after a seven-year exile. The more feisty Komische Oper is celebrating its 70th anniversary. And the Deutsche Oper continues to unearth unusual repertory in the western part of Berlin.

2018-03-30.abstract: Our Easter movie hunt led to some oldies, including “King of Kings” and “The Greatest Story Ever Told.”
2018-03-30.snippet: Our Easter movie hunt led to some oldies, including “King of Kings” and “The Greatest Story Ever Told.”
2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: There are not a whole lot of what one could call “Easter movies,” perhaps because there’s no suspense involved in the holiday itself. While a good number of Christmas movies hinge on the question of whether a Christmas celebration will happen, or happen properly — this is a thread that runs from “It’s a Wonderful Life” to “The Santa Clause” and its ilk, including “Santa Claus Conquers the Martians” — families celebrating Easter don’t typically worry about pulling it off, so to speak. Unless cooking a rosemary-and-garlic leg of lamb — or hiding some chocolate eggs — poses a challenge.
2018-03-30.headline_main: From ‘Ben-Hur’ to ‘Hop,’ Slim Pickings From the Easter Bunny’s Basket

2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: “These are very simple moves,” Carmen de Lavallade told members of Dance Theater of Harlem recently. The young women gathered around her, soaking up every word and gesture that she had to offer, were transfixed by her hands. For this moment in “Dougla,” Geoffrey Holder’s celebrated 1974 ballet that she is helping to revive for the company, she fanned her elegant fingers — in the mesmerizing way that she does most everything.
2018-03-30.headline_main: Bringing Back ‘Dougla’ Is a Family Affair

So good luck with your legs of lamb, your big smoked hams, your brisket and matzo brei. Here’s hoping your hard-boiled eggs are perfect, your haroseth truffles beautiful, your lemon sweet rolls with cream-cheese icing sun-kissed and soft. We are here for all who need us at NYT Cooking, and offer recipes appropriate to whatever faith you have, including none, as some among us celebrate the rise and promise of spring.

Instead, she had to attend the Monroe School, 21 blocks away, crossing a dangerous rail yard and catching a school bus to get there.
2018-03-30.headline_main: Linda Brown and the Unfinished Work of School Integration

2018-03-30.abstract: Jujhar Khaira of the Oilers is nearing the end of his first full season in the N.H.L., where he is the only active player of Indian descent.

2018-03-30.abstract: Whether the corporate tax cut is successful depends less on how companies spend their windfall than on their investment behavior in the future, our columnist says.

2018-03-30.abstract: Pedestrian deaths by automobile have been in the news recently. When did this unfortunate trend begin, and did it receive press coverage?
2018-03-30.snippet: Pedestrian deaths by automobile have been in the news recently. When did this unfortunate trend begin, and did it receive press coverage?
2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: Q. It seems that pedestrian deaths receive attention only when they’re extraordinary in some way. Last month, a self-driving Uber killed a woman in Arizona; a few weeks before that, a driver ran a red light and fatally struck two children in Park Slope, Brooklyn. Did the first pedestrian death by automobile receive press coverage?
2018-03-30.headline_main: Who Was the First Person Killed by a Car in New York?

2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: Haider Ackermann will leave Berluti, the LVMH-owned fashion label and footwear house, the company announced on Friday. Mr. Ackermann had been at the label since September 2016, a short tenure even in the current cyclone of the fashion industry, where designer entrances and exits are common and many contracts are for three-year terms.

2018-03-30.snippet: A court in northwest China sentenced Gao Chengyong for a spree of rape-murders that went unsolved for years. His conviction was widely welcomed.
2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Thirty years after Gao Chengyong embarked on a succession of 11 rape-murders of women in northwest China, a court sentenced him to death on Friday, following an investigation that involved sifting through 230,000 fingerprints.

2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: It took only a couple of minutes of Strauss’s “Der Rosenkavalier” for the conductor Kirill Petrenko and the Bavarian State Orchestra to claim this score as their own on Thursday at Carnegie Hall. In the introduction to the opening act, the orchestra plays the rising, athletic motif of young Count Octavian, then the gentle, falling, noble theme of the Marschallin.
2018-03-30.headline_main: Review: An Ecstatic ‘Rosenkavalier’ Introduces a Conductor to Carnegie

2018-03-30.abstract: Mr. Coates’s “Between the World and Me,” which began as a personal address to his son, is being adapted for a communal performance at the Apollo Theater.
2018-03-30.snippet: Mr. Coates’s “Between the World and Me,” which began as a personal address to his son, is being adapted for a communal performance at the Apollo Theater.
2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: In 2000, Ta-Nehisi Coates and Kamilah Forbes shared a moment of intense pain. Their friend and former classmate Prince Jones had been shot to death by a police officer in Virginia. Mr. Coates wrote in his 2015 book “Between the World and Me” that after learning the news he dropped off his infant son with Ms. Forbes — called “Aunt Kamilah” in the book — so he could attend Jones’s funeral. “I sat there feeling myself a heretic, believing only in this one-shot life and the body,” he wrote.
2018-03-30.headline_main: Bringing the World of Ta-Nehisi Coates, Briefly, to Stage

2018-03-30.abstract: A Texas suburb was intentionally flooded to save the city of Houston. We followed homeowners as they decided whether to cut their losses or rebuild.
2018-03-30.snippet: A Texas suburb was intentionally flooded to save the city of Houston. We followed homeowners as they decided whether to cut their losses or rebuild.
2018-03-30.lead_paragraph: KATY, Tex. — When Hurricane Harvey struck Houston, floodwaters swept through Eileen and Jeff Swanson’s two-story brick home, blanketing the first floor in muck and nearly destroying a domestic existence 12 years in the making. Their china cabinet, in the family for three generations, was reduced to a sodden mess. A couch, once a soft red, had blushed into a watery burgundy; the carpet squished like grass at the bottom of a marsh. A dirty foot-high water line ran wall to wall, marking the local crest of an event that the National Weather Service called “the most significant tropical cyclone rainfall event in United States history.”
2018-03-30.headline_main: Brutal Choice in Houston: Sell Home at a Loss or Face New Floods

2018-03-31.snippet: Tensions rise as the West and Russia trade insults and expulsions. But the old Cold War restraints and channels of communication have been dismantled.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: To all outward appearances, Russia’s retaliatory expulsions of American and other diplomats followed the old Cold War pattern: A Soviet deed would prompt Western punitive measures. Moscow would blithely deny any wrongdoing, declare itself victimized by a two-faced West and strike back with equivalent measures. So it was, for example, when the United States boycotted the Moscow Olympics in 1980 over the invasion of Afghanistan and the Soviet Union led an Eastern Bloc boycott of the Los Angeles Games four years later. And so it is now again, in Vladimir Putin’s Russia.
2018-03-31.headline_main: A Colder War With Russia?

2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: In the past few weeks, Tiger Woods has made a seemingly improbable comeback on the golf course. But can his image rebound the same way off it?
2018-03-31.headline_main: Tiger Woods Is Back. Will Sponsors Buy In?

2018-03-31.abstract: A Kremlin-funded tour by a biker gang known as Putin’s Angels, agents of meddling and mayhem, stoked fears about what Russia is up to in Bosnia.
2018-03-31.snippet: A Kremlin-funded tour by a biker gang known as Putin’s Angels, agents of meddling and mayhem, stoked fears about what Russia is up to in Bosnia.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: BANJA LUKA, Bosnia and Herzegovina — The Night Wolves, a Russian motorcycle gang known as Putin’s Angels and widely feared as agents of meddling and mayhem beyond Russia’s borders, provoked more bemusement and giggles than awe on their latest outing, a nine-day tour of the Balkans designed to show that Russia still had some fervent friends left in Europe.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Russia’s Feared ‘Night Wolves’ Bike Gang Came to Bosnia. Bosnia Giggled.

2018-03-31.abstract: As bail has grown into a $2 billion industry, bond agents have become the payday lenders of the criminal justice world, offering quick relief to desperate customers at high prices.
2018-03-31.snippet: As bail has grown into a $2 billion industry, bond agents have become the payday lenders of the criminal justice world, offering quick relief to desperate customers at high prices.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Most bail bond agents make it their business to get their clients to court. But when Ronald Egana showed up at the criminal courthouse in New Orleans, he was surprised to find that his bondsman wanted to stop him.
2018-03-31.headline_main: When Bail Feels Less Like Freedom, More Like Extortion

2018-03-31.abstract: A group of childhood friends wants to create a safer community and challenge the notion that African-Americans can’t be cowboys.
2018-03-31.snippet: A group of childhood friends wants to create a safer community and challenge the notion that African-Americans can’t be cowboys.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: For Anthony Harris, 35, walking to the corner store to buy a soda in his hometown,  Compton, Calif., often comes with the risk of being stopped and searched by the police. But when Mr. Harris and other members of a group of horse riders known as the “Compton Cowboys” choose to ride their horses to the store, something entirely different happens.
2018-03-31.headline_main: For the Compton Cowboys, Horseback Riding Is a Legacy, and Protection

2018-03-31.abstract: When you’ve done the makeup of basically everyone in the world except the queen of England, what else could be next?
2018-03-31.snippet: When you’ve done the makeup of basically everyone in the world except the queen of England, what else could be next?
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: MONTCLAIR, N.J. — On a strangely warm morning in late winter, the cosmetics tycoon Bobbi Brown was in her new headquarters here: a former auto body shop left with pipes exposed and concrete floor unfinished. On a bookshelf was a case that used to belong to Frank Sinatra’s makeup man; a sign reading, “I’m Not Bossy, I’m the Boss”; and a photo of Ms. Brown dancing onstage with the rap star Flo Rida, “with my 14-year-old son watching in amazement or horror,” she said. “Please don’t find it on YouTube.”
2018-03-31.headline_main: Bobbi Brown Is Ready to Slay the Wellness Industry. Nicely.

2018-03-31.abstract: A man tails his wife because he suspects she’s meeting up with a co-worker on the sly. A neglected girlfriend feels threatened by her boyfriend’s new friend. The Sugars advise.
2018-03-31.snippet: A man tails his wife because he suspects she’s meeting up with a co-worker on the sly. A neglected girlfriend feels threatened by her boyfriend’s new friend. The Sugars advise.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: A man secretly tails his wife because he suspects she’s meeting up with a co-worker on the sly. A neglected girlfriend feels threatened by her boyfriend’s new friend. A woman has a blossoming crush on her friend’s ex. The Sugars answer these letters and more in today’s rapid fire episode about friends and lovers.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Listen to ‘Dear Sugars’: When a Friendship Threatens Your Significant Other

2018-03-31.abstract: Touring for her fourth studio album, getting a star on the Walk of Fame and channeling her own #MeToo memories into a message of empowerment.
2018-03-31.snippet: Touring for her fourth studio album, getting a star on the Walk of Fame and channeling her own #MeToo memories into a message of empowerment.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: POTOMAC, Md. — On a Friday evening in March, 10 studio musicians, most from Nashville, were tightly clustered in a living room here, tuning their instruments and waiting for Lynda Carter, the actress best known for playing Wonder Woman in the 1970s TV series of the same name.
2018-03-31.headline_main: What Is Former Wonder Woman Lynda Carter Doing These Days?

2018-03-31.abstract: On Tuesday, the streaming music giant will begin trading on the New York Stock Exchange. Its path ahead, however, is far from clear.
2018-03-31.snippet: On Tuesday, the streaming music giant will begin trading on the New York Stock Exchange. Its path ahead, however, is far from clear.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Back in Spotify’s early days, when the company was just a dozen people in a small office in Stockholm, Daniel Ek, a co-founder, liked to compare it to Apple and Google.
2018-03-31.headline_main: After Driving Streaming Music’s Rise, Spotify Aims to Cash In

2018-03-31.abstract: The Security Council targeted 27 ships and 21 shipping companies, in what a U.S. official called its largest ever such move against the North.
2018-03-31.snippet: The Security Council targeted 27 ships and 21 shipping companies, in what a U.S. official called its largest ever such move against the North.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — The United Nations Security Council has announced new measures against North Korea, blacklisting 27 ships, 21 shipping companies and one individual accused of helping the North evade previous sanctions.

2018-03-31.abstract: Some Brooklyn country music.
2018-03-31.snippet: Some Brooklyn country music.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Again, for people who didn’t read my old blog: I have a tradition, which I’m reviving, of posting videos once a week of performances by bands I like. But I couldn’t do it yesterday owing to tech problems at The Times. The good news is that this lets me post a video I shot myself, on my own phone: The Lone Bellow at Town Hall last night. It was an awesomely energetic performance. They do what they call “Brooklyn country music” — and half the concert was acoustic, like this:
2018-03-31.headline_main: Friday Night Music on Saturday: The Lone Bellow

2018-03-31.abstract: Roseanne is back, and she’s a Trump supporter. A Parkland shooting victim hits out at #WalkUpNotOut. A writer who’s gone cashless. And more.
2018-03-31.snippet: Roseanne is back, and she’s a Trump supporter. A Parkland shooting victim hits out at #WalkUpNotOut. A writer who’s gone cashless. And more.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Welcome to the weekend! It’s a holiday, so maybe you’ve got friends and family crowding the house. If you need a mental getaway, here’s some great journalism to feast on. The articles in this list are not political, for the most part, so feel free to discuss with frenemies and in-laws.
2018-03-31.headline_main: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads

2018-03-31.abstract: A new study reveals a network of tissue that acts as a “highway of moving fluid” but loses its shape when viewed.
2018-03-31.snippet: A new study reveals a network of tissue that acts as a “highway of moving fluid” but loses its shape when viewed.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Researchers have made new discoveries about the in-between spaces in the human body, and some say it’s time to rewrite the anatomy books.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Is This Tissue a New Organ? Maybe. A Conduit for Cancer? It Seems Likely.

2018-03-31.abstract: Romain Guimard met Sally Newman, a Charleston lawyer, when the circus was in town. He was her guest through couchsurfing.com.
2018-03-31.snippet: Romain Guimard met Sally Newman, a Charleston lawyer, when the circus was in town. He was her guest through couchsurfing.com.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Sally Corbette Newman and Romain Philippe Guimard were married March 31 at Mepkin Abbey, a Trappist monastery in Charleston, S.C. Adair F. Boroughs, a notary in South Carolina, officiated, with Harry T. Edwards, a senior circuit judge and the chief judge emeritus of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia in Washington, leading the ceremony.
2018-03-31.headline_main: A French Acrobat Sweeps Her Off Her Feet. Figuratively, Too.

2018-03-31.abstract: After nearing extinction 20 years ago, the Iberian lynx has made a comeback in southern Spain and Portugal, thanks to a vast recovery program funded by the European Union.
2018-03-31.snippet: After nearing extinction 20 years ago, the Iberian lynx has made a comeback in southern Spain and Portugal, thanks to a vast recovery program funded by the European Union.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: VILCHES, Spain — The Iberian lynx is a picky eater. Despite its agility and speed, it almost only chases rabbits.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Saving a Fussy Predator in Europe, With Help From 50,000 Rabbits

2018-03-31.abstract: A state proposal to limit the number of drugs covered by Medicaid, fiercely opposed by patients and drug companies, has drawn national attention as states struggle to pay for costly new medicines.
2018-03-31.snippet: A state proposal to limit the number of drugs covered by Medicaid, fiercely opposed by patients and drug companies, has drawn national attention as states struggle to pay for costly new medicines.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Massachusetts, which led the nation in expanding health insurance coverage, now wants to rein in the growth of prescription drug spending for low-income people on Medicaid, but its proposals have met an icy reaction from patients and drug companies.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Massachusetts, a Health Pioneer, Turns Its Focus to Drug Prices. It’s in for a Fight.

2018-03-31.abstract: A reporter finds parallels between his own story and the powerful and painful tales of those returning to Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria.
2018-03-31.snippet: A reporter finds parallels between his own story and the powerful and painful tales of those returning to Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Much has been reported on the hundreds of thousands of people who fled Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria’s powerful winds ravaged the island. But barely anything had been written about what it is like for Puerto Ricans who return to the island after months in exile — the basis for my recent story about a couple’s return home.
2018-03-31.headline_main: In Puerto Rico, Following Stories That Hit Close to Home

2018-03-31.abstract: A co-op owner wonders why building management keeps such tight controls over what residents can post on an online message board.
2018-03-31.snippet: A co-op owner wonders why building management keeps such tight controls over what residents can post on an online message board.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Q: I live in a large Upper West Side co-op with a BuildingLink online message board. Management approves all posts, without providing guidelines on what might be approved or rejected. This is a private bulletin board, and I don’t expect complete freedom of speech. Still, it feels like anything more than an innocuous “for sale” announcement gets blocked. The moderators have rejected posts about an Upper West Side school rezoning debate; a post questioning what materials would be used for building improvements; and a post from a shareholder asking about a Paris apartment exchange. Should we have a stated policy? Is management being too controlling or is this normal oversight? Can shareholders request that questions not be subject to management approval?
2018-03-31.headline_main: Can a Building Message Board Be an Open Forum?

2018-03-31.abstract: Three-cup chicken, pasta frittata, and more recipes for the weekend.
2018-03-31.snippet: Three-cup chicken, pasta frittata, and more recipes for the weekend.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: From Alison Roman’s garlic braised short ribs with red wine (above) to whole-lemon tart, here are the recipes readers loved most this week.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Our 10 Most Popular Recipes Right Now

2018-03-31.abstract: With no other choice, tens of thousands of Syrians have fled to Idlib, a rebel-held province, where they are caught between government attacks from the sky and Islamists on the ground.
2018-03-31.snippet: With no other choice, tens of thousands of Syrians have fled to Idlib, a rebel-held province, where they are caught between government attacks from the sky and Islamists on the ground.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — When pro-government forces retook her hometown from Syrian rebels, Nisrine accepted the same surrender deal the government has offered tens of thousands of Syrians: a one-way bus trip to a place she had never been — the northern, rebel-held province of Idlib.
2018-03-31.headline_main: ‘2 Bitter Options’ for Syrians Trapped Between Assad and Extremists

2018-03-31.abstract: As a challenge to the country’s collective memory, two artists unveiled a monument to a 19th-century figure who led a fiery revolt against Danish colonial rule in the Caribbean.
2018-03-31.snippet: As a challenge to the country’s collective memory, two artists unveiled a monument to a 19th-century figure who led a fiery revolt against Danish colonial rule in the Caribbean.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: COPENHAGEN — The statue of the woman is nearly 23 feet tall. Her head is wrapped and she stares straight ahead while sitting barefoot, but regally, in a wide-backed chair, clutching a torch in one hand and a tool used to cut sugar cane in the other.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Denmark Gets First Public Statue of a Black Woman, a ‘Rebel Queen’

2018-03-31.abstract: David Matthews, an owner of the luxury resort Eden Rock, has strongly denied the accusation, which dates to the 1990s.
2018-03-31.snippet: David Matthews, an owner of the luxury resort Eden Rock, has strongly denied the accusation, which dates to the 1990s.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: PARIS — A millionaire British hotel owner who is the father-in-law of Pippa Middleton, the sister of the Duchess of Cambridge, is under formal investigation in France over allegations that he raped an underage girl in the 1990s, a French judicial official said.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Pippa Middleton’s Father-in-Law Faces Rape Investigation in France

2018-03-31.abstract: Political leaders in Albany leave an ambitious Manhattan congestion zone out of the state budget, but include new surcharges on Uber and taxi rides
2018-03-31.snippet: Political leaders in Albany leave an ambitious Manhattan congestion zone out of the state budget, but include new surcharges on Uber and taxi rides

2018-03-31.abstract: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon, take a good look in the mirror.
2018-03-31.snippet: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon, take a good look in the mirror.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — It’s fitting that our merry pranksters get cute today. I’ll mention only a couple of things about my experience solving this backward creation: First, I’m grateful that so many clues were straightforward (ha-ha), and second, I very specifically felt discomfort and distress at the exact same point I discovered those words in this passage. I don’t know whether to chalk that up to suggestibility or if the Cox-Rathvon team made that happen somehow.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Variety: Acrostic

2018-03-31.abstract: After a slow start, the two-time defending champions
2018-03-31.snippet: After a slow start, the two-time defending champions
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Sidney Crosby mulled the query. Could he fathom already being 13 seasons into his N.H.L. career?
2018-03-31.headline_main: Sidney Crosby and Penguins Try to Peak at the Right Time

2018-03-31.abstract: For years, employees complained about the behavior of the head of the division, Kevin Carwile, and what they viewed as a toxic culture.
2018-03-31.snippet: For years, employees complained about the behavior of the head of the division, Kevin Carwile, and what they viewed as a toxic culture.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Kevin Carwile arrived to run the Justice Department’s death penalty unit in 2010, he had never prosecuted or sat through an entire capital punishment case. He was moved into the job after overseeing the gangs unit, and some prosecutors worried he lacked the expertise to steer the division.
2018-03-31.headline_main: At the Justice Dept.’s Death Penalty Unit, Accusations of Favoritism, Gender Bias and Unwanted Groping

2018-03-31.abstract: A new therapeutic array of ballpark fragrances at a Bronx nursing home helps older residents recall their youthful trips to Yankee Stadium.

2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Rochelle Youner, who lives at the Hebrew Home at Riverdale, a nursing home in the Bronx, walked up to a kiosk in a common area of the home’s first floor and pressed a button below a small icon depicting a baseball glove.
2018-03-31.headline_main: In the Bronx, Stadium Scents Take Fans Out to the Ballgame

2018-03-31.abstract: Amazon and Google have filed patent applications, many still under consideration, that outline how digital assistants can monitor more of what users say and do.

2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Ever since Eve bit into an apple in the Garden of Eden, God has been rough on women.

2018-03-31.snippet: Can post-Christian spirituality make a bridge between the sexes?
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: The men fled; the women stayed.

2018-03-31.snippet: A tale of two Kushner brothers, on either side of the fractious Trump divide.

2018-03-31.headline_main: Javanka vs. the Klossy Posse

2018-03-31.abstract: The Fox News host was criticized for saying that the Parkland shooting survivor David Hogg was whining about getting rejected from colleges. Fox News said her vacation was preplanned.

2018-03-31.abstract: He was a man of faith, but his faith demanded action.
2018-03-31.snippet: He was a man of faith, but his faith demanded action.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: In June 1966, less than two years before he was killed, the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. preached from his Atlanta pulpit of the dynamic dance between Good Friday and Easter, between death and resurrection, between despair and hope.
2018-03-31.headline_main: We Forgot What Dr. King Believed In

2018-03-31.abstract: The president sticks his head in the sand as his administration’s hostility toward science continues.
2018-03-31.snippet: The president sticks his head in the sand as his administration’s hostility toward science continues.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: The other day, Scott Pruitt, the administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, took yet another step to muzzle the scientific inquiry that for years has informed sound policy at an agency he seems determined to destroy. He told his subordinates that they could no longer make policy on the basis of studies that included data from participants who were guaranteed confidentiality. Over the years, such studies have been crucial to establishing links between mortality and pollution, led to regulations and saved many lives. Limiting policymakers to only those studies with publicly available health data greatly narrows the field of research.
2018-03-31.headline_main: At Pruitt’s E.P.A.: No Studies, No Data, No Rules

2018-03-31.abstract: Most white evangelicals would vote against Jesus Christ himself if he ran as anything but a Republican.
2018-03-31.snippet: Most white evangelicals would vote against Jesus Christ himself if he ran as anything but a Republican.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Now that Stormy Daniels has confirmed on national television that Donald Trump initiated sex with her just months after his third wife gave birth to their child, at least half the country is asking: Surely this is a porn star too far for white evangelical Christians, right?
2018-03-31.headline_main: Democrats Are Christians, Too

2018-03-31.abstract: In 1968, Spiro Agnew was the man of the white, suburban moment.
2018-03-31.snippet: In 1968, Spiro Agnew was the man of the white, suburban moment.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: A few days after the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., the Republican governor of Maryland, Spiro T. Agnew, strode into a conference room in downtown Baltimore. In the hours after King’s death, violence had broken out in the city; along with Washington and Chicago, it was soon occupied by the United States Army. In response, Agnew called together the black community on April 11 for “a frank and far-reaching discussion.”
2018-03-31.headline_main: How the Party of Lincoln Became the Party of Racial Backlash

2018-03-31.abstract: Those working on period health in the developing world are focused on handing out products. They should be combating stigma.
2018-03-31.snippet: Those working on period health in the developing world are focused on handing out products. They should be combating stigma.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: The period is finally having its moment.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Menstrual Pads Can’t Fix Prejudice

2018-03-31.abstract: I learned at Parris Island that the Marine Corps has lower expectations of its female recruits.
2018-03-31.snippet: I learned at Parris Island that the Marine Corps has lower expectations of its female recruits.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Marine Corps recruits arrive for the Emblem Ceremony on Parris Island, S.C. — the event near the end of boot camp where they officially become Marines — mosquito-bitten and sunburned, sand wedged under their fingernails and dug into their scalps.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Separate Is Not Equal in the Marine Corps

2018-03-31.abstract: Christ was untouched by decay when he resurrected; the rest of us need fungi, bacteria and bugs to perform the resurrection part of the life cycle.
2018-03-31.snippet: Christ was untouched by decay when he resurrected; the rest of us need fungi, bacteria and bugs to perform the resurrection part of the life cycle.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: I’m in the odd position of being someone who loves detritivores, that is, things that eat the dead. Believe me, it’s not an easy sell at a dinner party. Usually when I reveal my interest, people recoil. Often when I shake someone’s hand and I mention we are sharing mites that eat dead skin cells, I sense my enthusiasm isn’t mutual.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Decomposition: An Easter Story

2018-03-31.abstract: Widespread use of automated vehicles might one day result in fewer car-related deaths, but in the meantime we should focus on proven solutions
2018-03-31.snippet: Widespread use of automated vehicles might one day result in fewer car-related deaths, but in the meantime we should focus on proven solutions
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: The promise of self-driving cars can be alluring — imagine taking a nap or watching a movie in a comfortable armchair while being shuttled safely home after a long day at work. But like many optimistic images of the future, it is also a bit of an illusion.
2018-03-31.headline_main: The Bright, Shiny Distraction of Self-Driving Cars

2018-03-31.abstract: It’s a pop culture stereotype and a term we apply to loved ones. But people should know who it honors.
2018-03-31.snippet: It’s a pop culture stereotype and a term we apply to loved ones. But people should know who it honors.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO, Calif. — My son’s school, David Starr Jordan Middle School, is being renamed. A seventh grader exposed the honoree, Stanford University’s first president, as a prominent eugenicist of the early 20th century who championed sterilization of the “unfit.”
2018-03-31.headline_main: The Nazi History Behind ‘Asperger’

2018-03-31.abstract: The Trump administration makes it difficult, but the answer here is more diplomacy.
2018-03-31.snippet: The Trump administration makes it difficult, but the answer here is more diplomacy.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Last week, following the brazen attempt by Russia to assassinate one of its former spies and his daughter in Britain with a chemical weapon, 27 countries expelled more than 150 Russian diplomats. Moscow swiftly and predictably reciprocated,  announcing  that it would expel 60 American diplomats.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Putin Has Overplayed His Hand

2018-03-31.abstract: ‘Oklahoma’ revolutionized Broadway, and gave a war-weary country reason to hope.
2018-03-31.snippet: ‘Oklahoma’ revolutionized Broadway, and gave a war-weary country reason to hope.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Seventy-five years ago this April Fool’s morning, a line of ticket buyers stretched down West 44th Street outside the St. James Theatre in Manhattan, and a policeman struggled to keep order at the box office. A new musical play had opened the night before and taken the town by storm. “Wonderful is the nearest adjective for this excursion,” this newspaper’s critic proclaimed, in a judgment almost universally shared from that day to this. The show was “Oklahoma!”
2018-03-31.headline_main: The ‘Hamilton’ of World War II

2018-03-31.abstract: The Nobel laureate Malala Yousafzai said it was “like a dream” to return home to Pakistan’s Swat Valley, where the Taliban tried to kill her in 2012.
2018-03-31.snippet: The Nobel laureate Malala Yousafzai said it was “like a dream” to return home to Pakistan’s Swat Valley, where the Taliban tried to kill her in 2012.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — Malala Yousafzai, the Pakistani activist for girls’ education and the world’s youngest Nobel laureate, visited her hometown in Pakistan on Saturday for the first time since the Taliban attempted to assassinate her in 2012.
2018-03-31.headline_main: ‘Like a Dream’: Malala Makes an Emotional Visit to Her Pakistani Hometown

2018-03-31.abstract: The delicacy once smothered local reefs in South Africa, but the shellfish has become more difficult to find as a result of overfishing, luring untrained divers into more deadly waters.
2018-03-31.snippet: The delicacy once smothered local reefs in South Africa, but the shellfish has become more difficult to find as a result of overfishing, luring untrained divers into more deadly waters.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: HANGBERG, South Africa — One man vanished diving at midnight. Another was attacked by a great white shark in deep water. Two more drowned, one in borrowed scuba gear he wasn’t qualified to use.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Divers Risk Drowning and Sharks to Poach Abalone Worth $200 a Pound

2018-03-31.abstract: Mr. Belzberg was a Canadian who, with his brothers, amassed a fortune using the “greenmail” takeover tactic and later reinvented himself as a private-equity investor.
2018-03-31.snippet: Mr. Belzberg was a Canadian who, with his brothers, amassed a fortune using the “greenmail” takeover tactic and later reinvented himself as a private-equity investor.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Samuel Belzberg, a feared corporate raider of the 1980s who perfected the contentious practice known as greenmail to build one of Canada’s foremost family dynasties, then reinvented himself as a successful private-equity investor, died on Friday night in a hospital in Vancouver, British Columbia. He was 89.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Samuel Belzberg, Corporate Raider in a Family Dynasty, Dies at 89

2018-03-31.snippet: Readers respond to various articles about the papacy of Francis at five years.

2018-03-31.headline_main: As Pope Francis Changes the Church

2018-03-31.abstract: Mississippi State did the unthinkable last year, beating UConn with a late jumper in the national semifinals. Notre Dame did it this year. On Sunday, they’ll meet in this year’s final.
2018-03-31.snippet: Mississippi State did the unthinkable last year, beating UConn with a late jumper in the national semifinals. Notre Dame did it this year. On Sunday, they’ll meet in this year’s final.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio — In this age of social media — at least until Friday night — it had been the most famous shot in women’s college basketball, taken by the smallest player on the court to defeat the biggest opponent, Connecticut.
2018-03-31.headline_main: What N.C.A.A. Women’s Finalists Share: Big Shots That Felled a Giant

2018-03-31.abstract: Gov. Cuomo is using the state’s $168 billion plan as a way to exert control over New York City, to thumb the eye of its mayor and to raise his national profile.
2018-03-31.snippet: Gov. Cuomo is using the state’s $168 billion plan as a way to exert control over New York City, to thumb the eye of its mayor and to raise his national profile.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: ALBANY — In his ceremonial unveiling of the new state budget on Friday, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo presented the $168 billion blockbuster as a rebuttal to Washington, a defiant thrust of the chin at President Trump.
2018-03-31.headline_main: In New York Budget, a Fusillade Against de Blasio

2018-03-31.abstract: The company said a Model X was using Autopilot when it hit a concrete divider on March 23. The system, one analyst said, “works fine, until it suddenly doesn’t.”
2018-03-31.snippet: The company said a Model X was using Autopilot when it hit a concrete divider on March 23. The system, one analyst said, “works fine, until it suddenly doesn’t.”
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: In the fall of 2016, Tesla beamed new software over the air to cars on the road in the United States and elsewhere that added safeguards to its Autopilot system to prevent drivers from looking away from the road or keeping their hands off the steering wheel for long periods of time.
2018-03-31.headline_main: Fatal Tesla Crash Raises New Questions About Autopilot System

2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — On a recent afternoon, the staff of The South China Morning Post, a 114-year-old newspaper, gathered around roast suckling pig in their lavish new headquarters in Hong Kong to celebrate a remarkable turnaround.

2018-03-31.abstract: Baseball teams have been scooping up younger players. And then there’s the Mets. Can a focus on veterans work in today’s game?
2018-03-31.snippet: Baseball teams have been scooping up younger players. And then there’s the Mets. Can a focus on veterans work in today’s game?
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla. — Jose Reyes, a Mets infielder, arrived in the major leagues at age 19, smirking at older players like John Franco, the timeless relief pitcher who, at age 42, was still at it.
2018-03-31.headline_main: If the Mets Succeed, They’re Experienced. If They Fail, They’re Old.

2018-03-31.abstract: After some inefficiency early on, DeGrom ended up allowing just five Cardinals to reach base.
2018-03-31.snippet: After some inefficiency early on, DeGrom ended up allowing just five Cardinals to reach base.
2018-03-31.lead_paragraph: Two games into the season, the Mets have produced two wins with stout pitching and solid hitting, but a 6-2 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals on Saturday also produced the Mets’ first injury exit of 2018.
